title: Mumbai Airport News: Checked-in bag tampered with, flyer loses Rs 1 lakh, 78-year-old pen at Mumbai airport
text: MUMBAI: In a case of theft from a checked-in bag , a director with a Manipal Group company lost Rs 1 lakh in cash and a 78-year-old fountain pen while flying from Mangaluru to Mumbai Wednesday. The flyer, who suspects the hand of airport employees, said he had to wait for almost five hours in Mumbai to lodge a police complaint.Binod Kumar Mandal (46) said after landing at the domestic terminal, he found his bag's number lock and the zip had been tampered with. On a 2-day official trip, he said he had carried the cash for emergency. "The fountain pen, valued at Rs 5,000, was a family heirloom...a gift from my grandfather who had bought it in 1946."He said despite thefts being rampant on flights, few approach police or the airline concerned "as these authorities test the patience of people already in shock".B inod Kumar Mandal, who is director with a Manipal Group firm, lost Rs 1 lakh in cash and a Rs 5,000 fountain pen from his checked-in bag while flying from Mangaluru to Mumbai on Wednesday. He said he had kept the cash in the bag thinking it cannot be stolen . Besides, he said “there is always a possibility of a pickpocket or snatching when you enter a new city”.“I am from Kolkata but have been working in Mangaluru with Manipal Tech Group Companies,” he told TOI. He said authorities test the patients of people who go to them with such complaints “instead of solving their problems”. “In my case, I had the proof of money that I had withdrawn from the bank that I carried with me,” he said.Mandal said this is the first time he has experienced baggage theft although he is a frequent flyer. “It is a handin-glove act by people inside the airport, otherwise the theft would not have occurred. I suspect that the person who does the baggage scanning would have tipped off the loader who would have stolen the cash at a place where there is no CCTV coverage,” he said. Police have registered a case of theft against an unknown person.
summary:
MUMBAI: In a case of theft from a checked-in bag , a director with a Manipal Group company lost Rs 1 lakh in cash and a 78-year-old fountain pen while flying from Mangaluru to Mumbai Wednesday.
"The fountain pen, valued at Rs 5,000, was a family heirloom...a gift from my grandfather who had bought it in 1946.
He said authorities test the patients of people who go to them with such complaints “instead of solving their problems”.
“It is a handin-glove act by people inside the airport, otherwise the theft would not have occurred.
Police have registered a case of theft against an unknown person.

title: Suchana Seth: 'Can't tolerate...': says Bengaluru's killer mom Suchana Seth's note written with an eyeliner
text: PANAJI: A six-line note scribbled by data scientist and startup founder Suchana Seth on a crumpled tissue found inside the suitcase bearing the body of her murdered four-year-old son points to her state of mind and assigns a possible motive for the killing, police said on Thursday."Court and my (estranged) husband pressurising me to give custody of my son, and I cannot take it anymore," says the note, written with an eyeliner."My ex-husband is violent... he used to teach bad manners to (my) son. I don't want to give even a day's custody to the father."Investigators said Suchana "sang a lullaby" to her son in an attempt to get the child to sleep before allegedly murdering him."The note we have attached is a crucial piece of evidence in the case, establishing her mental condition," an officer said. "The issue of custody of her son must have been at the back of her mind for many days, triggering the drastic step."Police will send the note for forensic verification of the handwriting."She was in touch with her doctor, a parental therapist, before committing the crime. We are verifying call details to know who she called after the boy's death," the officer said.Room 404 of Hotel Sol Banyan Grande at Candolim is where Suchana allegedly smothered her son to death and slit her wrist in a suspected suicide attempt. Two empty bottles of cough syrup were found in the room, suggesting she tried to intoxicate her son.She was arrested while fleeing Goa by taxi with the child's body stuffed in a suitcase and put in the boot of the car.
summary:
"Court and my (estranged) husband pressurising me to give custody of my son, and I cannot take it anymore," says the note, written with an eyeliner.
I don't want to give even a day's custody to the father.
"Investigators said Suchana "sang a lullaby" to her son in an attempt to get the child to sleep before allegedly murdering him.
"The note we have attached is a crucial piece of evidence in the case, establishing her mental condition," an officer said.
"The issue of custody of her son must have been at the back of her mind for many days, triggering the drastic step.

title: On a wing & a prayer
text:
On a wing & a prayer

Amit Singh

Jan 11, 2024, 19:52 IST IST

Serious problems with Boeing planes as well as Airbus planes running on Pratt & Whitney engines could mean big disruption in global & Indian aviation. Engineering is an issue. But so is the quality of engineers, especially in India. Aviation needs its own IITs

Boeing 737 Max has been a cause for worry since its launch, and the woes just don’t seem to end. Aircraft groundings and investigations over the last few days following an incident in the US are a sample of what the global aviation industry has experienced.

Missteps earlier | In 2018 and 2019, Boeing 737 Max fleets in Indonesia and Ethiopia recorded accidents. Investigations attributed the same to a new component being installed without prior information and training for flight crews. The consequence was a ‘nosedive’ and aircraft crashing.
summary:
On a wing & a prayerAmit SinghJan 11, 2024, 19:52 IST ISTSerious problems with Boeing planes as well as Airbus planes running on Pratt & Whitney engines could mean big disruption in global & Indian aviation.
Aviation needs its own IITsBoeing 737 Max has been a cause for worry since its launch, and the woes just don’t seem to end.
Aircraft groundings and investigations over the last few days following an incident in the US are a sample of what the global aviation industry has experienced.
Missteps earlier | In 2018 and 2019, Boeing 737 Max fleets in Indonesia and Ethiopia recorded accidents.
Investigations attributed the same to a new component being installed without prior information and training for flight crews.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex closes over 840 points up, Nifty50 nears 21,900
text: Stock market today : Indian benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50 , witnessed a significant surge on Friday, with the Sensex rallying over 900 points and the Nifty breaking its previous all-time high. The 50-share pack index reached a peak of over 21,928, led by gains in heavyweights TCS and Infosys.BSE Sensex closed the trading day at 72,568.45, up 847 points or 1.18%.Nifty50 too was up 1.14% or 247 points at 21,894.55. While BSE Sensex hit an intraday high of 72,720.96, Nifty50 saw a high of 21,928.In dollar terms, the Indian stock market is now valued at around $4.49 trillion, positioning itself to potentially surpass Hong Kong as the world's fourth-largest hub of equities, according to an ET report.The Nifty IT sector emerged as the top gainer, surging by about 5%, with Infosys gaining around 8% and Coforge by 5%. Other IT stocks such as Tech Mahindra, Wipro, TCS, Mphasis, and LTIMindtree also experienced gains of about 4% each. The market rally was primarily triggered by the strong buying interest in IT stocks following the inline results of Infosys and the positive surprise from TCS. Experts predict that the recent quarters' strong deal wins will gradually translate into revenue in the coming quarters, further strengthening the sector.The sustainability of this rally will depend on the ongoing December quarter earnings season, which is expected to be a crucial factor driving market returns in the near term. The recent substantial increase in the shares of Reliance Industries (RIL) has also provided support to the index. Additionally, market participants will closely monitor the HDFC Bank results on January 16th for insights into the direction of Bank Nifty.V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services stated that the resilience in IT stocks and strength in Reliance will enable Nifty to consolidate around 21,600 levels. HDFC Bank results on January 16th will be keenly watched by the market for cues in the direction of Bank Nifty.The US Department of Labor's consumer price index (CPI), a crucial indicator of inflation, showed a 3.4% increase compared to the previous year, surpassing November's figure.While the US market remained relatively unchanged due to higher-than-expected inflation, Japan's Nikkei share average reached a new 34-year peak on Friday, influencing positive sentiments in the Indian market.The US CPI inflation inching up to 3.4% YoY is slightly negative from the global equity market perspective. The rate cut expected from the US Fed in March this year may not materialize. It is likely to be postponed to June, and therefore, rate cuts by the MPC will also get delayed, said Vijayakumar.Wall Street equities closed with little change after data revealed that headline CPI rose above estimates at 0.3% in December, resulting in an annual gain of 3.4%.
summary:
Stock market today : Indian benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50 , witnessed a significant surge on Friday, with the Sensex rallying over 900 points and the Nifty breaking its previous all-time high.
Other IT stocks such as Tech Mahindra, Wipro, TCS, Mphasis, and LTIMindtree also experienced gains of about 4% each.
The market rally was primarily triggered by the strong buying interest in IT stocks following the inline results of Infosys and the positive surprise from TCS.
The recent substantial increase in the shares of Reliance Industries (RIL) has also provided support to the index.
The rate cut expected from the US Fed in March this year may not materialize.

title: 'MS Dhoni has given me two-three...': Shivam Dube explains the secret behind his transformation
text:
Wisden picks 2023 men’s ODI team of the year, includes 7 Indians in the XI

NEW DELHI: Marking a dynamic comeback to the Indian team, Shivam Dube played a pivotal role with a powerful 60 not out off 40 balls in the first T20I against Afghanistan. He attributed the positive shift in his attitude and approach to the iconic MS Dhoni , whose influence has been instrumental in Dube's cricketing journey.Dube's impactful half-century significantly contributed to India's comfortable six-wicket victory on Thursday, earning him the well-deserved Player of the Match award."When I came to bat, I wanted to implement what I have learnt from MS Dhoni about finishing games. I keep speaking to Mahi bhai. He tells me about how to tackle different situations. He has given me two-three tips and rated my batting."So, I feel if he rates my batting then I'll keep playing well. My confidence went up because of that," Dube told 'JIO Cinema'.Dube's previous appearance for India was in last year's Asian Games at Hangzhou.The Mumbai player was part of the India squad for home T20I series against Australia but did not get a chance to play and was not selected for the away series against South Africa.Dube also found shades of Dhoni in the wayRohit Sharma captained the side, and allowed him the space to perform."Both allow me to bat higher in the order. There's a lot of work to be done and I know they will back me and want me to do well. So, that makes me feel a lot more positive," he added.Dube also grabbed the important wicket of Afghan captain Ibrahim Zadran (25 off 22 balls), and the pacer said he has been working on his bowling."The changes have not come suddenly. In the off-season, I worked a lot on my fitness. After that, I bowled a lot in domestic cricket too so things kept improving."I was able to find the right areas and also generate a decent pace," he said.
summary:
"When I came to bat, I wanted to implement what I have learnt from MS Dhoni about finishing games.
He has given me two-three tips and rated my batting.
There's a lot of work to be done and I know they will back me and want me to do well.
After that, I bowled a lot in domestic cricket too so things kept improving.
"I was able to find the right areas and also generate a decent pace," he said.

title: Atal Setu Inauguration Live: 'Hold cleanliness drive in temples ahead of Ram Mandir inauguration,' says PM Modi
text:
THE TIMES OF INDIA | Jan 12, 2024, 15:54:21 IST Share Follow us

LIVE NOW

Mumbai Trans Harbour Link Inauguration Live Updates: PM Modi to inaugurate Atal Setu bridge shortly

Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to Atal Setu, or Mumbai Trans Habour Link (MTHL), the country's longest sea bridge by travelling on the sea-bridge from INS Shikara in Colaba to Navi Mumbai today. The toll rates for passenger vehicles on the Sewri-Shivaji Nagar (Ulwe) stretch have been revised to Rs 200, and for the 2.5km Shivaji Nagar-Gavhan stretch, it is fixed at Rs 50. This is a change from the earlier announcement of a flat Rs 250 toll for the entire stretch. For a return trip, the toll will be 1.5 times the one-way charge. Commuters can start using the 21.8km sea bridge. MTHL will feature interchanges at Sewri in Mumbai and Shivaji Nagar, Jassi, and Chirle on National Highway 4B in Navi Mumbai. The 21.8 km sea bridge will be open to commuters from January 13. PM held a mega roadshow ahead of the inauguration. PM Inaugurated the Nashik Youth festival and addressed the youth urging them to take India to new heights.Read Less
summary:
This is a change from the earlier announcement of a flat Rs 250 toll for the entire stretch.
Commuters can start using the 21.8km sea bridge.
MTHL will feature interchanges at Sewri in Mumbai and Shivaji Nagar, Jassi, and Chirle on National Highway 4B in Navi Mumbai.
The 21.8 km sea bridge will be open to commuters from January 13.
PM Inaugurated the Nashik Youth festival and addressed the youth urging them to take India to new heights.Read Less

title: It is time for the US to go back to Afghanistan
text:
It is time for the US to go back to Afghanistan

Kathy Gannon

New York Times Jan 5, 2024, 11:53 IST IST

The US needs to realise that not all Afghans support the relentless restrictions on girls and women. It needs to facilitate a way forward and for that it needs to come down to the war-torn country

It’s striking how much Afghanistan , which has the unfortunate legacy of being the site of America’s longest war, has all but disappeared from public discussion in the United States. But perhaps it’s understandable. After all, there always seems to be another conflict, another war — which, as it happens, is also Afghanistan’s history.

Since 1979, Afghans have lived in almost perpetual conflict. Millions of people have been forced to flee their homes or their country. Foreign interventions have come and gone, ending in failure, leaving Afghans and their neighbours to live with the consequences.
summary:
It needs to facilitate a way forward and for that it needs to come down to the war-torn countryIt’s striking how much Afghanistan , which has the unfortunate legacy of being the site of America’s longest war, has all but disappeared from public discussion in the United States.
After all, there always seems to be another conflict, another war — which, as it happens, is also Afghanistan’s history.
Since 1979, Afghans have lived in almost perpetual conflict.
Millions of people have been forced to flee their homes or their country.
Foreign interventions have come and gone, ending in failure, leaving Afghans and their neighbours to live with the consequences.

title: 'Both Katrina Kaif and Vijay Sethupathi have elevated the writing with their performances in Merry Christmas' - Sriram Raghavan- Exclusive!
text:
One of the best

filmmakers

in the neo-noir thriller genre, Sriram Raghavan's

Merry Christmas

has hit screens today. Starring

Katrina Kaif

and Vijay Sethupathi in lead roles, the bilingual movie has been grabbing eyeballs ever since its trailer dropped. In a quick chat with ETimes, the director, known for movies like 'Ek Hasina Thi' and 'Andhadhun', takes us through his latest offering, his filmmaking challenges and more...

What made you decide to make Merry Christmas?

Did the title Merry Christmas evolve over time?

Were Katrina Kaif and Vijay Sethupathi the original choices? If yes, why did you want them for their respective roles?

Did Katrina and Vijay surprise you as actors in any way?

In what ways are the Hindi and Tamil versions of the film different from each other?

Do you think the Christmas week of 2023 was a better window for the release?

What kind of battles do you still have to fight to make the cinema of your choice?

Merry Christmas First Day First Show Public Review: Katrina Kaif, Vijay Sethupathi, Sriram Raghavan

After Merry Christmas, what are you going to make next?

How was it working with Dharmendra in Ikkis?

How do you look at your journey in cinema so far?

It's been 20 years since you made your first feature. Do you think you could have directed more films?

Is there a film that you have been wanting to make, but haven't got the chance to make it?

The way films are made (the show and the biz part of it), what is something that you've made peace with, considering you've had to fight to make the kind of cinema you want ?

How is Katrina as an actor? The general impression is that she is a huge star, but as an actor she still needs a role that challenges her..

In 2004, when Ram Gopal Varma watched the final cut of Ek Hasina Thi, he told me, 'you have made a good film.Now don’t try to repeat it. You should do something completely different.' That stuck with me... Andhadhun was a big success with the audiences and critics. I was very clear that I do not want to follow that template for success. I had the story of Merry Christmas for a few years, and felt it was a good time to do it. Since the earlier film was a success, I felt encouraged to take some fresh risks.Oh yes, I had a couple of Hindi titles based on some of my favourite songs. Some options I remember are Raat akeli Hai, Raat ke Hamsafar, Baat ek raat ki and so on. Then came Honey Trehan’s Raat akeli hai and I felt any title with raat would give a similar vibe. It was Dinesh Vijan who suggested MERRY CHRISTMAS as a title. It was simple, and yet perfect in the context of our story.I wanted the story to have a dream-like quality. In my mind, I tried various conventional pairings, but some X factor seemed to be missing. Most of the stars had already worked with each other. Since the story is about two strangers meeting on Christmas eve, I wanted an out of the box pairing. Katrina is a glamorous star and Vijay is known for his rooted characters. The opposites attracted me.Definitely. It was the first time I was working with either of them. I can happily say that they enhanced the writing with their performances. I mean, how do you write chemistry in a script? That was purely on them.It is the same source material but the two languages have different idioms, and there are subtle differences in both versions.Definitely. We had announced our release in December, but then I saw that the month was packed with big releases, and we didn’t want to get caught in the blood bath. We would also not get our choice of cinemas, hence we pushed the dates.The usual battles. Casting choices, budgets, trailer cutting, marketing ideas and more. Most important is the battle within the mind, regarding how best to tell the story in a cinematic manner.I have already commenced shooting of IKKIS, based on the story of Arun Khetarpal, the young tank commander who was martyred whilst defending a crucial sector in the 1971 war. It stars Dharmendra and Jaideep Ahlawat, along with Agastya Nanda, who plays the war hero. We have completed an important section of the film. We will resume shooting from February this year.Dharamji is a treat to work with. As an actor, he is hungrier and more hard working than many younger actors today. Everyone loves him on the sets. I thoroughly enjoy talking to him about some of the great films and directors he has worked with in his illustrious career.I have been lucky with my actors and even though every film wasn’t a huge hit, we never lost money, and managed to make our kind of cinema.Well…definitely, but for various reasons it didn’t happen. Ridley Scott and Woody Allen would have made twenty films in this period!Luckily, I have not had a dearth of producers who are willing to back me. I have various ideas, treatments which are half done, or half baked, so it is always a work in progress.I don’t enjoy promotions, but I know it needs to be done, simply to spread awareness about the film. My films mostly rely on word of mouth publicity. And hopefully, good reviews by esteemed critics.Please watch MERRY CHRISTMAS and you will get your answer...
summary:
Did the title Merry Christmas evolve over time?
Merry Christmas First Day First Show Public Review: Katrina Kaif, Vijay Sethupathi, Sriram RaghavanAfter Merry Christmas, what are you going to make next?
I had the story of Merry Christmas for a few years, and felt it was a good time to do it.
It was Dinesh Vijan who suggested MERRY CHRISTMAS as a title.
And hopefully, good reviews by esteemed critics.Please watch MERRY CHRISTMAS and you will get your answer...

title: Why it is important to have pet festivals
text:
Pet Fed is like a

carnival for pets

and pet lovers, with many activities and workshops.

What inspired you to create this event for our furry friends and their owners?

Why do you think there is a need for more festivals like this?



How do you think the festival contributes to strengthening the bond between pets and the owners?



Tell us about some pets that remain etched in your memory?



What are the challenges that you initially faced while organising the festival?



What's your personal favorite activity or workshop that you believe every pet parent should experience at least once?

The connection we share with our pets is a special and cherished relationship that brings joy, companionship, and a unique form of love into our lives. It goes beyond a mere companionship; it's a bond that enriches our daily experiences. Akshay Gupta, Founder of Pet Fed, talks in detail about why it is important to have pet festivals and how celebrating your furry friends can go a long way in changing the way we look at them.I started Pet Fed back in 2014 when I realized that there is an event for every liking of a human being in the country whether it is food, fashion, art, music but there was not anything for people who had pets and pets themselves. For every other thing there is a community of people that you can engage, interact and learn with but there was not anything from pet parents so we thought that we will create something of that sort. Pets and pet parents can come together at a common platform and learn from each other and see what is there in the category for better pet parenting.I think we need to have and encourage more festivals like this so that we can promote pet welfare, strengthen the bond between pets and their owners, and build a sense of community among pet enthusiasts. Main focus is to highlight the importance of Adopting the Pet instead of buying and selling them. We always follow our motto #AdoptDontShop and we want our audience to follow this motto. As you know, selling and buying is not good and appropriate, but adoption allows us to freely choose the pet we want without comparing and buying. It provides shelter for the needy. Pet welfare includes the well-being, health, and humane treatment of animals kept as pets. Ensuring good pet welfare involves meeting their physical, behavioral, and emotional needs.The bond between pet and the owners has to be understanding which requires attention and patience to deal with.Organizing events like this can contribute to raising awareness about responsible pet ownership, providing a space for pet-related businesses to showcase their products and services, and fostering a positive environment for pets and their owners to socialize. Pet festivals like Pet Fed play a crucial role in fortifying the bond between pets and their owners. By offering a plethora of shared experiences, from engaging in various activities to participating in workshops, these events create everlasting memories that deepen the emotional connection.The socialization opportunities provided in festival settings help pets become more accustomed to diverse environments and foster positive behavior in social settings. Fun and play activities, alongside pet-friendly services, contribute to the enjoyment and well-being of pets, reinforcing positive associations with the festival experience. Additionally, participating in training sessions and bonding activities encourages effective communication and teamwork between pets and their owners. The sense of community fostered by pet festivals, where owners share stories and tips, further strengthens the support network and a feeling of belonging. Through talent showcases and celebrations dedicated to the unique bond, these festivals become a joyous ode to the special relationship between pets and their devoted owners.Every Pet Fed festival always has some special memory in our hearts but what always stands out for us is not just dogs and cats. Each year we get to witness a wide variety of pets we never thought and imagined in our lives! From iguanas, hamsters, snakes, to chameleons you name it. Every species shares a special bond with their pet parent.Organizing Pet Fed involves lots of research and experiences and it takes such a toll in our lives because everything is at stake! Initially we faced several challenges like the intricate details of logistics and planning to the complexities of budgeting and securing sponsorships. Marketing and promoting the event, ensuring participant engagement, proactive volunteers, leads and coordinators. Outdoor festivals are susceptible to weather conditions, which can impact attendance and logistics.Contingency plans for unexpected situations are vital.Compliance with regulations, vendor and sponsor management, and prioritizing security and safety add further layers of complexity. Safety and Security is a major concern of our team, where it is essential to be particular and considerate about pets, their owners, participants and team. Feedback collection and progress with every improvement are critical aspects of successful event organization. All it requires and demands meticulous planning, effective communication, and a team capable of addressing a diverse range of issues to deliver a memorable and seamless experience for participants.With in-numerous activities at Pet Fed, there's something for everyone.A masterclass at Pet Fed can be a highly enriching experience for pet parents, offering in-depth insights and expert guidance on various aspects of pet care. These sessions often delve into advanced training techniques, behavior management, and health and wellness practices. Renowned trainers, veterinarians, or specialists may conduct these masterclasses, providing a platform for attendees to deepen their understanding of their pets' needs and behaviors. Whether it's an advanced training masterclass, a deep dive into pet nutrition, or an exploration of holistic well-being, these sessions empower pet parents with practical knowledge and skills. Masterclasses at Pet Fed offer a unique opportunity for attendees to learn from leading experts in the field, enhancing their ability to provide the best possible care for their furry companions.
summary:
Pet Fed is like acarnival for petsand pet lovers, with many activities and workshops.
Pet festivals like Pet Fed play a crucial role in fortifying the bond between pets and their owners.
The sense of community fostered by pet festivals, where owners share stories and tips, further strengthens the support network and a feeling of belonging.
Every species shares a special bond with their pet parent.Organizing Pet Fed involves lots of research and experiences and it takes such a toll in our lives because everything is at stake!
Whether it's an advanced training masterclass, a deep dive into pet nutrition, or an exploration of holistic well-being, these sessions empower pet parents with practical knowledge and skills.

Quotes:

da

Srijit Mukherji and Sara Sengupta make for the perfect mentor and protégé . Ever since he launched industry veterans Jisshu and Nilanjanaa Senguptaa’s teenaged daughter in, the filmmaker has been her biggest cheerleader at every step she has taken towards the limelight. The model actress, on the other hand, remains his most devoted student and fan.In a first suchhosted by Calcutta Times, the duo got chatting about everything from K-Drama to handling trolls and more. Enjoy!Honestly, that makes me feel very old (). Her turn asin the 2018 film is still so fresh in my mind, that when I see her now it’s a clash of visions. Like it happened in my last life or something, because she looks nothing like that anymore. She’s grown into such a beautiful lady, so elegant and graceful. Then obviously there’s her professional achievement, being a model for an international label. I am overwhelmed and proud, but I also marvel at what time can do. To people, to faces, to lives. She’s that living testimony of the wonders of time.: I think he introduced me to a whole new world. Something I’ve only seen mom and dad do. I think the first time he came over, at night, to our home and suddenly said: ‘’ It took off from there.: If you go back to theanalogy, I was that port key into that wizarding world of Hogwarts. A world she was familiar with, thanks to her parents, but her parents were very strict about letting her into that world. I had to convince her parents that she is very comfortable in that world. She belongs there. When she was dancing at a recent party, I told Nilanjanaa (her mother) Look! I told you, she’s very comfortable here.: There was a scene in Uma, where I had to dance and I was moving slowly, softly, it wasn’t working out. And he was just like, “dance,” and I was like “okay.” And then I cried after that because I think I definitely was an introvert up to that point. Gradually it changed and I think I got comfortable with that scene onwards.: I think she cried because when an actor’s inhibition breaks down, you are in touch with your real self, with a world that was behind the wall, you’ve not seen. She was introverted. After that she took off and now look at her!: I think it’s the ‘Don’t be afraid to try’ spirit. I’ve gone with my parents to their shoots and I’ve seen them act. I knew you need a lot of confidence to do what comes to them so easily. There are so many people behind the camera who are watching you act, do something. But you have to play the role you have been given. It requires a lot of confidence and taking the leap is what I’ve learnt from him. Thank you for that! (So I was just having this conversation with her father. I was saying that now looking at her I think, she should come back with a love story. Her father said very interestingly that, I think you should cast her as a serial killer (). I told Jisshu, it’s my fault, I have only given you negative roles, fromtoto, making you a household name for grey characters. But why do I also want to push Sara down there?: Oh! So this has gone to Kajol and still not come to me?! (: It was very spontaneous.: I will make it a point to read some of her stuff.Just some poetry I’ve been writing. Not many people know about this. Now the world’s gonna know about this.: What kind of music do you like?: Kishore Kumar ! () Sara: Do you like Arctic Monkeys or The Neighbourhood?: Arctic Monkeys is something which my niece had once told me about. Not so much into it. What are your thoughts on K-Pop? Worth visiting?: I was obsessed with K-pop. But I think I’ve grown out of it.: What about Korean dramas?: Korean dramas are good. I do enjoy them if it’s a mafia K-drama. Then their romance stuff is good.: What about gore?I am not that great with gore, but if it’s crime and dystopia, I’m completely fine. One of my favourites is pro“I love layered, morally grey characters that can go to extremes. I am intrigued by their motive, their childhood trauma and backstories”“Sara’s ready for a relaunch. If she were to play a serial killer, maybe Jisshu would be the other killer, or the cop on her trail!”“Sara’s strength is her spontaneity and elegance. That’s the essence I captured in Uma. It was the only film I’ve written keeping the character in mind, apart from Autograph, which I wrote for Bumba(Prosenjit)”
summary:
SaraSmiles at SrijitSrijit, if you were to cast her in a film now, what kind of a role would it be?
Her father said very interestingly that, I think you should cast her as a serial killer ().
But I think I’ve grown out of it.
If she were to play a serial killer, maybe Jisshu would be the other killer, or the cop on her trail!”“Sara’s strength is her spontaneity and elegance.
It was the only film I’ve written keeping the character in mind, apart from Autograph, which I wrote for Bumba(Prosenjit)”

title: Anirudha Roy Chowdhury: Despite their vast experiences, Amitabh Bachchan and Pankaj Tripathi remain hungry for perfection - Exclusive!
text:
Following your impactful contributions to films such as 'Pink' and 'Lost,' what motivated you to undertake the project of 'Kadak Singh'?

We have a sea of talented actors in Indian cinema; why did you opt for Pankaj Tripathi to play this role?

Have you had the opportunity to watch Pankaj's earlier movies, and if so, which one resonated with you the most?

Pankaj Tripathi reveals real-life gangsters approached him after the success of 'Gangs of Wasseypur'

Having collaborated with both Amitabh Bachchan and Pankaj Tripathi, what common traits or similarities have you observed in their approach to acting?

Among Amitabh Bachchan, Pankaj Tripathi, Jami Gautami, and Taapsee Pannu, which actor would you consider someone who aligns particularly well with the director's?

Is your deliberate choice to frequently explore themes of thrillers, mysteries, and serious social dramas in your films a conscious decision to steer clear of commercial masala films?

In a candid interview with ETimes, Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury, who is known for his directorials, namely 'Pink', 'Lost', and others, shares insights on a journey behind the scenes of his latest creation, ' Kadak Singh '. As the master storyteller opens up about the inspiration behind the film and the meticulous casting process, the interview provides insight into the deliberate selection of Pankaj Tripathi for the role of the grounded officer grappling with financial fraud.Anirudh praises Tripathi's authenticity, versatility, and less-is-more approach, expressing the conviction that the actor was the perfect fit for the character's complex persona. Not just that, comparisons are drawn between working with acting legends Amitabh Bachchan and Pankaj Tripathi.Below are excerpts from the interview:Whenever I make a film, I have an urge to tell a particular story and evoke certain emotions that I can relate to. These are experiences either I or my close circle have encountered. All my films, be they Bengali or Hindi, are drawn from the atmosphere and events around me. Kadak Singh is a story I wanted to share about financial crimes and how people exploit others, particularly the middle class. The film sheds light on the cheat fund issue, where common people were duped. I may not be a government official, but through my art, I can initiate a conversation and create awareness. Kadak Singh also explores a dysfunctional family and an intense, unnamed love affair, such as the relationship between a nurse and a patient, showcasing emotional and intellectual support. The film emphasises the importance of taking responsibility in life—for nature, the environment, and each other.When casting for a film, I create a wish list. Pankaj Tripathi perfectly fits the role of a grounded officer dealing with financial fraud. His authentic appearance aligns with the character's background. Additionally, the narrative demands a determined yet dysfunctional character, showcasing a complex relationship and retrograde amnesia. Pankaj is a great actor, authentic, and unbelievable. He is super. His less-is-more approach suits the character. When I met him, there was a conviction that he was the perfect fit. It's a symbiotic and organic evolution in casting.I loved his films like 'Newton', 'Mirzapur', 'Bareilly Ki Barfi', and 'Mimi'. Pankaj is a versatile and realistic actor who brings authenticity to every role. His performance in 'Criminal Justice' as a lawyer was particularly commendable.Both actors, despite their vast experience, remain hungry for perfection. Mr. Bachchan, in particular, stays on set, displaying a commitment and integrity that everyone should learn from. Their dedication gives not only an on-screen result but also an energy that enriches everyone around them.In cinema, collaboration is key. A director's role is to inspire, tell a story, and convince. It's about creating harmony and collaboration. Every actor, including Taapsee, Jami, and Pankaj, has contributed positively, and the exchange of thoughts and ideas leads to the creation of a film.My films, whether serious social dramas or relationship-oriented, can be commercial too. The focus is on telling a truthful story with the right intent. Commercial success doesn't necessarily mean following a formula; it's about creating commerce through authentic storytelling. Intent and belief in the story are crucial to me.
summary:
Following your impactful contributions to films such as 'Pink' and 'Lost,' what motivated you to undertake the project of 'Kadak Singh'?
We have a sea of talented actors in Indian cinema; why did you opt for Pankaj Tripathi to play this role?
Pankaj Tripathi reveals real-life gangsters approached him after the success of 'Gangs of Wasseypur'Having collaborated with both Amitabh Bachchan and Pankaj Tripathi, what common traits or similarities have you observed in their approach to acting?
Among Amitabh Bachchan, Pankaj Tripathi, Jami Gautami, and Taapsee Pannu, which actor would you consider someone who aligns particularly well with the director's?
Pankaj Tripathi perfectly fits the role of a grounded officer dealing with financial fraud.

title: Vijay Sethupati: 10 statements by Vijay Sethupati which reveal the simple soul within
text:
Here’s why Vijay Sethupati doesn’t disclose much about his life

Katrina Kaif drops pictures with 'Merry Christmas' co-star Vijay Sethupathi, fans shower love

Challenges of answering the same questions

Embracing acceptance amidst body-shaming

The style choices

Vijay Sethupathi reveals he was body-shamed in Bollywood and Tamil industry; here's why!

Dedication to

in ‘Jawan’

Taking life in stride

Language and confidence

Fan love

Working with

Katrina Kaif

In the glitzy world of cinema, where glamour often takes center stage, actor Vijay Sethupati emerges as a beacon of simplicity. With the release of his latest film, ‘ Merry Christmas ,’ today, let's delve into 10 statements by Vijay Sethupati that not only echo his down-to-earth nature but also reveal the simple soul within.During a conversation with Film Companion, Vijay Sethupati expressed his apprehension about excessive exposure, fearing it might disconnect his audience from the characters he portrays. He shared, "I fear too much exposure, talking so much about films and about myself. I fear I may detach my audience from my characters, and my films. I don’t want to disturb them while watching films. Even on my Instagram, I have only a couple of personal photos. Earlier, there were only one or two award shows and you would get to see actors at very few moments. Now, there is too much exposure, which makes me afraid.”Reflecting on the challenge of providing answers, he stated, "Bohot sochna padta hai jawaab ke liye, dimaag ka batti nahi jalta hai (I have to think a lot for an appropriate answer. The brain doesn’t work at such times). So, it’s better to keep quiet. If a person thinks of me as an intellectual after watching my film, then let that imagination be. Better to be an intellectual and brilliant actor in someone’s imagination, it’s nice. It’s better than coming and showing myself as a dumb actor. This is not a humble answer, it is real.”In an interaction with Indian Express, Vijay Sethupati opened up about facing body-shaming and the acceptance he found. He revealed, "Main aisa hi tha, body shaming bohot kiya tha mujhe (I have faced a lot of body-shaming for the way I look). Wahaan bhi kiya tha (they also did it). It happened, but the good thing is that people accept you the way you are. Today wherever I go, I am accepted, it is a blessing. (It’s all) thanks to my audience that I am happy being myself. I didn’t expect this, I didn’t…"Regarding his simple style choices, he shared, "Sometimes I am conscious about my costumes because I believe in wearing what I am comfortable in. Sometimes people say I am showing off, sometimes they say I am too simple. Chappal pehnega toh simple matlab kya (how is wearing slippers equal to being simple?). But sometimes I am conscious of that also. If I go to functions, I see people dressed up really well, and I get really conscious. So mostly I try to avoid going for get-togethers and meetings generally, otherwise, I am comfortable."Speaking to First Post, Vijay Sethupati revealed his unwavering commitment to his craft, particularly in the film "Jawan." He declared, “I did Jawan only for Shah Rukh Khan sir; even if I didn’t get a single penny, I would have still worked with him.”During a conversation with Pinkvilla, Vijay Sethupati shared his laid-back philosophy towards life. He said, "I just came to cinema, I wanted to be a serial artist and then became a hero in the film and then everything it happened, maybe I don’t take life that serious. I’m just the flow. When you have a target and you want to achieve something, it’s like already chalna bahut mushkil hai to upar aur zyada vazan rahega aur bhi mushkil ho jaayega (you have a long journey to cover and with mental pressure it will become even more difficult). Just you go. It's nice. You may cross deserts, mountains, seas-everything. It's an experience."In an interview with PTI, Vijay Sethupati expressed gratitude for the opportunities that came his way, admitting, "It is a huge blessing and I didn't expect this. I didn't have this much confidence. I was worried about my language (skills). When they approached me for Mumbaikar or Gandhi Talks, I was like I'm going to do only that and it's not going to be many films."He also emphasized the significance of fan love, saying, "I believe fans are fans and their love is so true. Receiving love from fans is like an energy drink. When people love you, it gives you hope that your work has reached people they have understood and they really like your work. That’s what I understood from the fan clubs. That always gives me energy."During a press conference, Vijay Sethupati discussed his initial apprehension about working with Katrina Kaif. He admitted, "I like Katrina, she has been in the industry for almost two decades. I didn't know how she would behave, so thoda darr tha as I was going to work with her. Suppose the actor has an attitude then it becomes difficult to share the screen with them because the rhythm would not match. But the moment she entered and the discussion began, it was so healthy and sensible. She likes to talk more, discuss more, listen more and everything is more, which made me very comfortable, so the first fear is gone."
summary:
Dedication toin ‘Jawan’Taking life in strideLanguage and confidenceFan loveWorking withKatrina KaifIn the glitzy world of cinema, where glamour often takes center stage, actor Vijay Sethupati emerges as a beacon of simplicity.
With the release of his latest film, ‘ Merry Christmas ,’ today, let's delve into 10 statements by Vijay Sethupati that not only echo his down-to-earth nature but also reveal the simple soul within.During a conversation with Film Companion, Vijay Sethupati expressed his apprehension about excessive exposure, fearing it might disconnect his audience from the characters he portrays.
This is not a humble answer, it is real.”In an interaction with Indian Express, Vijay Sethupati opened up about facing body-shaming and the acceptance he found.
"Speaking to First Post, Vijay Sethupati revealed his unwavering commitment to his craft, particularly in the film "Jawan."
"During a press conference, Vijay Sethupati discussed his initial apprehension about working with Katrina Kaif.

title: Passengers dress as Lord Ram and Hanuman on first flight to Ayodhya from Ahmedabad
text:
Other passengers and Indigo staff clamoured for pictures with the divinely dressed quartet. Source: ANI

The ensuing pandemonium has been hailed by some X users as a moment of joy and excitement while others have called this a grab for attention and a 'mockery' of faith. Source: ANI

First flight departs from Ahmedabad for Ayodhya; passengers dressed up as Lord Ram, Lakshman

The holy city of Ayodhya , famous for being the birthplace of Lord Ram , witnessed a unique spectacle on January 11, 2024, when the first direct flight from Ahmedabad arrived with passengers dressed as Lord Ram, Lakshman, Sita, and Hanuman . The devotees, who boarded the IndiGo flight, were excited to visit the newly constructed Ram temple, which is scheduled to have its grand consecration ceremony on January 22 this year.The flight, which took off from Ahmedabad at 8:15 am, was part of the new connectivity initiative launched by IndiGo to link Ayodhya with other major cities in India. The airline started its first flight to Ayodhya from Delhi on January 6, coinciding with the inauguration of the Maharishi Valmiki International Airport by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The airport, which is expected to boost tourism and pilgrimage in the region, will also have direct flights from Mumbai in the coming weeks.The passengers, who arrived at the Ahmedabad airport in their costumes, said they wanted to express their devotion and joy for the historic occasion. They also said they hoped to get a glimpse of the Ram temple, which has been built on the site where Lord Ram is believed to have been born. There was clear excitement in the air as joyous chants of Jai Shri Ram rang through the airport. The temple, which has been a matter of faith and controversy for decades, was finally cleared for construction after a Supreme Court verdict in 2019. The foundation stone was laid by PM Modi on August 5, 2020, amid the Covid-19 pandemic.The temple, which is being built in the Nagara style of architecture, will have a height of 161 feet and a width of 270 feet. It will have five domes, 360 pillars, and 106 spires. It will also have a museum, a library, a research center, and a food court. The temple complex will cover an area of 67 acres, which will also include a garden, a water body, and a meditation center.The consecration ceremony, which is expected to attract lakhs of devotees from across the country and abroad, will be held on January 22, which coincides with the Basant Panchami festival. The ceremony will be performed by the chief priest of the temple, Satyendra Das, along with other priests and dignitaries. The ceremony will involve various rituals, such as the installation of the idol of Lord Ram, the invocation of the deities, and the offering of prayers. The ceremony will also be broadcast live on various platforms, such as TV, radio, and social media.
summary:
Other passengers and Indigo staff clamoured for pictures with the divinely dressed quartet.
Source: ANIFirst flight departs from Ahmedabad for Ayodhya; passengers dressed up as Lord Ram, LakshmanThe holy city of Ayodhya , famous for being the birthplace of Lord Ram , witnessed a unique spectacle on January 11, 2024, when the first direct flight from Ahmedabad arrived with passengers dressed as Lord Ram, Lakshman, Sita, and Hanuman .
They also said they hoped to get a glimpse of the Ram temple, which has been built on the site where Lord Ram is believed to have been born.
There was clear excitement in the air as joyous chants of Jai Shri Ram rang through the airport.
The ceremony will involve various rituals, such as the installation of the idol of Lord Ram, the invocation of the deities, and the offering of prayers.

title: Shoshimin: How to become Ordinary anime set to premiere in July 2024
text:
TVアニメ「小市民シリーズ」ティザーPV｜2024年7月放送開始

Prepare to delve into the captivating world of the Shoshimin Series mystery novels as it takes a vibrant leap onto the small screen with the upcoming TV anime adaptation , "Shoshimin: How to become Ordinary," scheduled to premiere in July. The anticipation is already building, fueled by the recent release of a teaser trailer and a visually stunning preview.The narrative of Shoshimin unfolds around Jogoro Kobato (portrayed by Shuuichi Umeda), a young man endowed with exceptional deductive skills, and Yuki Osanai (brought to life by Hina Youmiya), a girl characterized by acute perception and unwavering determination.Despite their longing for an ordinary life, Kobato is haunted by past adversities, while Osanai grapples with the weight of previous setbacks. Unfortunately for them, their high school transforms into a breeding ground for enigmatic cases and misfortunes, making the pursuit of normalcy an elusive endeavor.Steering the helm of this animated adaptation is Mamoru Kanbe, known for his work on " The Perfect Insider " and " The Promised Neverland ," and the project is brought to life by Lapin Track. Toshiya Oono, recognized for his contributions to "Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation Season 2," spearheads the series composition.Atsushi Saitou, acclaimed for his work on "Love Live! Superstar!!," takes on the role of character designer, adding his artistic flair to the production. Meanwhile, the musical tapestry of Shoshimin will be woven by the skilled hands of Takahiro Obata, renowned for his work on "The Promised Neverland."The source material for this eagerly awaited anime is the Shoshimin book series, penned by the talented Honobu Yonezawa and published by Tokyo Sogensha under its Sougen Suiri Bunko label. The series comprises four volumes released between 2004 and 2009, with a short story compilation hitting the shelves in 2020. The popularity of the novels has also led to the creation of manga adaptations based on the first two books.As the clock ticks down to the July premiere, fans can hardly contain their excitement for the extraordinary journey that "Shoshimin: How to become Ordinary" promises to deliver, blending mystery, drama, and the pursuit of a normal life in a seamless and enthralling narrative.

title: '12th Fail': When unexpected fans of Vikrant Massey shattered Vidhu Vinod Chopra's hopes for a trouble-free filming experience
text:
Vikrant Massey kisses Sheetal Thakur at fun-filled baby shower, shows diaper changing skills!

Vikrant Massey , the versatile actor in Indian cinema, has garnered immense love and admiration from audiences for his role as Manoj Sharma in the real-life-inspired film " 12th Fail ," directed by Vidhu Vinod Chopra . The film has not only showcased Vikrant's acting prowess but also elevated him to a prominent position in the industry, establishing him as a household name across the nation.Before "12th Fail," Vikrant had already gained recognition, boasting a considerable fan following owing to his exceptional talent.A crew member from the film's set shared an anecdote about Vidhu Vinod Chopra's astonishment at Vikrant's popularity, recounting a conversation where Chopra expressed his initial assumption that casting Vikrant would facilitate a hassle-free shoot in Mukherjee Nagar. However, Vikrant's unexpected stardom disrupted those plans, with thousands of fans thronging the shooting location.Talking about the fan base of Vikrant Massey, a crew member of 12th Fail shared a glimpse from the sets of the film and wrote,“The conversation that took place here was something like this:VVC: “Yaar mujhe laga tujhe picture mein lunga toh aaram se Mukherjee Nagar mein shoot kar lunga. Lekin saala tu toh star nikla yaar! (I thought if I cast you, then we’d be able to shoot in Mukherjee Nagar without any hassles, but you turned out to be an effin’ star!"VVC’s words and @vikrantmassey’s sheepish grin were a result of the thousands and thousands of people that flocked outside this location to watch the shooting of the film. VVC’s hopes of having a hassle-free shoot in Mukherjee Nagar were disrupted on Day 1 itself.Unable to clear the chaos, 1st AD @narulakunal1 smartly manipulated the crowd in such a way that we ended up using this shot in the film.”Looking ahead, Vikrant Massey has an exciting lineup of projects, including "Section 36," "Phir Aayi Hasseen Dillruba," and an untitled romantic drama alongside Raashi Khanna.
summary:
Vikrant Massey kisses Sheetal Thakur at fun-filled baby shower, shows diaper changing skills!
Vikrant Massey , the versatile actor in Indian cinema, has garnered immense love and admiration from audiences for his role as Manoj Sharma in the real-life-inspired film " 12th Fail ," directed by Vidhu Vinod Chopra .

title: New Zealand vs Pakistan, 1st T20I Highlights: New Zealand beat Pakistan by 46 runs
text: Earlier in the game, Pakistan won the toss and opted to field first on what looked like a pristine wicket. Shaheen Afridi dismissed Devon Conway in the first over itself but then came the hammering from Finn Allen who did get out on a No Ball and mustered up quick runs before falling inside the Powerplay yet again. It was then the dynamic duo of Kane Williamson and Daryl Mitchell that came good for New Zealand once again and the latter simply smashed it to all parts of the ground. Adam Milne hit a few lusty blows and Mark Chapman's stellar cameo in the end took the Black Caps to a mammoth total of 226. For Pakistan, the debutant Abbas Afridi stood out with the ball as he took three scalps and remained fairly economical given the runs scored in the game and so did Haris Rauf. Rest of the bowlers were handed a thumping and two of them even conceded more than 50 runs in their 4 overs. Coming to the chase, the game hung in the balance for a long time but when it really mattered, the hosts got the wickets and sealed the win.
summary:
Earlier in the game, Pakistan won the toss and opted to field first on what looked like a pristine wicket.
Adam Milne hit a few lusty blows and Mark Chapman's stellar cameo in the end took the Black Caps to a mammoth total of 226.
For Pakistan, the debutant Abbas Afridi stood out with the ball as he took three scalps and remained fairly economical given the runs scored in the game and so did Haris Rauf.
Rest of the bowlers were handed a thumping and two of them even conceded more than 50 runs in their 4 overs.
Coming to the chase, the game hung in the balance for a long time but when it really mattered, the hosts got the wickets and sealed the win.

title: Infosys announces its first acquisition of the year 2024, here are the details
text:
What does InSemi do

Infosys leadership on the acquisition

Infosys stock sees biggest jump since 2016

Indian IT giant Infosys has announced its first acquidsition of the year 2024. In a statement, the company said that it will acquire InSemi , a semiconductor design and embedded services provider. Infosys is acquiring the Bengaluru-based company for Rs 280 crore.In a filing on Bombay Exchange, Infosys said the acquisition of Rs 153.6 crore revenue InSemi is expected to close during the fourth quarter of fiscal 2024, subject to customary closing conditions. "Consideration including earn-outs, and management incentives, and retention bonus totaling up to INR 280 crores subject to customary closing adjustments," Infosys statement added. The Bengaluru-headquartered InSemi has a headcount of over 900 employees.Founded in 2013, InSemi offers end-to-end semiconductor design services with expertise across electronic design, platform design, automation, embedded and software technologies. It serves leading global corporations across semi-conductor, consumer electronics, automotive, and hi-tech industries."This strategic investment further strengthens Infosys’ engineering R&D capabilities and demonstrates its continued commitment to co-create with global clients to help them navigate their digital transformation journey," said the company.Dinesh R, EVP & Co-Delivery Head, Infosys, said, “Infosys has been a leader and at the forefront of delivering cutting edge solutions across industries with Engineering R&D services. With the advent of AI, Smart devices, 5G and beyond, electric vehicles, the demand for next-generation semiconductor design services integrated with our embedded systems creates unique differentiator. InSemi is a strategic investment as we usher a next wave of growth and a leadership position in Engineering R&D.”"Over the last five years, InSemi has built a foundation with solid growth and design capabilities across the semiconductor value chain. With Infosys as our catalyst, it creates a synergistic combination that allows us to scale and bring the power of AI & Engineering R&D and next-generation technology to global clients, expanding across industry sectors. We aim to further accelerate our progress and together with Infosys, it paves a path of innovation opening new opportunities for our teams", said Shreekanth Sampigethaya & Arup Dash, Co-Founders, InSemi.Shares of Infosys jumped over 7 per cent in early trade on Friday (January 12), adding Rs 42,821.36 crore to its market valuation, after the company's December quarter earnings came in-line with market expectations. The stock rallied 7.15 per cent to Rs 1,604.90 on the BSE after a firm beginning. The market capitalisation (mcap) of the IT services firm jumped Rs 42,821.36 crore to Rs 6,63,303.78 crore in early trade.On Thursday (January 11), Infosys narrowed its sales growth forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2024 to between 1.5% and 2%, expecting clients to remain cautious about purchasing software services.
summary:
In a statement, the company said that it will acquire InSemi , a semiconductor design and embedded services provider.
Infosys is acquiring the Bengaluru-based company for Rs 280 crore.In a filing on Bombay Exchange, Infosys said the acquisition of Rs 153.6 crore revenue InSemi is expected to close during the fourth quarter of fiscal 2024, subject to customary closing conditions.
The Bengaluru-headquartered InSemi has a headcount of over 900 employees.Founded in 2013, InSemi offers end-to-end semiconductor design services with expertise across electronic design, platform design, automation, embedded and software technologies.
"This strategic investment further strengthens Infosys’ engineering R&D capabilities and demonstrates its continued commitment to co-create with global clients to help them navigate their digital transformation journey," said the company.Dinesh R, EVP & Co-Delivery Head, Infosys, said, “Infosys has been a leader and at the forefront of delivering cutting edge solutions across industries with Engineering R&D services.
With the advent of AI, Smart devices, 5G and beyond, electric vehicles, the demand for next-generation semiconductor design services integrated with our embedded systems creates unique differentiator.

title: Bigg Boss Tamil 7: Sanam Shetty praises RJ Bravo for exposing allegations; Says 'Best re-entry forever'
text: Bigg Boss Tamil 7 , former contestant Sanam Shetty expressed her gratitude towards RJ Bravo boldly exposing "fake allegations " and bravely opening up about the bully gang during the 'BB friend fest' task.Actress Sanam Shetty, who participated in Bigg Boss Tamil 5, took to her official social media to commend RJ Bravo's courage in addressing the issue and labelling his re-entry as the "best forever."The controversy surrounded allegations against fellow contestant Pradeep, and RJ Bravo openly discussed his doubts about the authenticity of the claims during a conversation with finalist Archana.In a video shared on social media, Sanam Shetty praised Bravo for his humility in acknowledging his earlier mistake of blindly trusting certain individuals and commended him for bringing to light the injustice done to Pradeep.In her post, Sanam Shetty wrote, "Brave #Bravo This man has the humility to accept his mistake of blindly trusting those women... and the guts to speak up against the injustice done to #pradeep When the rest are busy spreading poison, he spread light. The name clearance which didn't come from the host and channel finally comes through @being_bravo to @thedhaadiboy_ We will also never forget #dinesh #vichitra & #archana for exposing this issue first against all odds"Sanam Shetty, known for her contributions to the South Indian entertainment industry, including Tamil and Kannada films, has made her mark in both the film and reality show realms. The actress holds the title of "Miss South India 2016" and has appeared in films like 'Sadhuram 2,' 'Narmatha Pramod,' and 'Walter.' Her participation in Bigg Boss Tamil 4 further added to her widespread recognition.Simultaneously, the latest episode of Bigg Boss Tamil 7 unveiled the list of the top five finalists competing for the prestigious 'Bigg Boss Tamil 7 title': Archana, Maya, Vishnu, Vijay, Mani, and Dinesh. With the stakes at an all-time high, the competition intensifies, making each move and decision a pivotal factor in determining the ultimate winner.As the season approaches its climax with only three days left, viewers are eagerly anticipating the unfolding drama, twists, and intense moments in the upcoming episodes. Don't miss the next instalment of Bigg Boss Tamil Season 7, promising a thrilling conclusion to an already eventful season.
summary:
Bigg Boss Tamil 7 , former contestant Sanam Shetty expressed her gratitude towards RJ Bravo boldly exposing "fake allegations " and bravely opening up about the bully gang during the 'BB friend fest' task.Actress Sanam Shetty, who participated in Bigg Boss Tamil 5, took to her official social media to commend RJ Bravo's courage in addressing the issue and labelling his re-entry as the "best forever.
The actress holds the title of "Miss South India 2016" and has appeared in films like 'Sadhuram 2,' 'Narmatha Pramod,' and 'Walter.'
Her participation in Bigg Boss Tamil 4 further added to her widespread recognition.Simultaneously, the latest episode of Bigg Boss Tamil 7 unveiled the list of the top five finalists competing for the prestigious 'Bigg Boss Tamil 7 title': Archana, Maya, Vishnu, Vijay, Mani, and Dinesh.
With the stakes at an all-time high, the competition intensifies, making each move and decision a pivotal factor in determining the ultimate winner.As the season approaches its climax with only three days left, viewers are eagerly anticipating the unfolding drama, twists, and intense moments in the upcoming episodes.
Don't miss the next instalment of Bigg Boss Tamil Season 7, promising a thrilling conclusion to an already eventful season.

Bank holidays January 2024: In 2015, the Reserve Bank of India established that all Indian banks, whether private or public sector, would remain closed on the second and fourth Saturdays of each month. Despite this, confusion persists among bank customers regarding whether the upcoming Saturday is a working day or a day off. Here are all the details you need to know about the upcoming bank holidays.In January 2024, banks will be closed for a total of 16 days, which includes the second and fourth Saturdays, Sundays, and other regional holidays. To eliminate any confusion, here are the details of the upcoming weekends.Saturday, January 13, 2024, will be a non-working day for banks as it falls on the second Saturday of the month.On Monday, January 15, 2024, banks will be closed in several states due to the Uttarayana Punyakala/Makar Sankranti Festival/Maghe Sankranti/Pongal/Magh Bihu.The following states will observe a bank holiday on this day: Karnataka, Orissa, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Sikkim, and Assam. As January 13 is a bank holiday (second Saturday) and Sunday is a recognised holiday, banks in these states will enjoy an extended weekend.Apart from the regional holidays, some well-known national bank holidays in India include Gandhi Jayanti (October 2), Independence Day (August 15), Republic Day (January 26), and Christmas (December 25). Additionally, there are various religious holidays, the dates of which may vary each year.
summary:

Hazarat Ali 25 Republic Day 26Bank holidays January 2024: In 2015, the Reserve Bank of India established that all Indian banks, whether private or public sector, would remain closed on the second and fourth Saturdays of each month.
Despite this, confusion persists among bank customers regarding whether the upcoming Saturday is a working day or a day off.
As January 13 is a bank holiday (second Saturday) and Sunday is a recognised holiday, banks in these states will enjoy an extended weekend.Apart from the regional holidays, some well-known national bank holidays in India include Gandhi Jayanti (October 2), Independence Day (August 15), Republic Day (January 26), and Christmas (December 25).
Additionally, there are various religious holidays, the dates of which may vary each year.

title: Setback for Byju’s: BlackRock slashes valuation by whopping 95% to just $1 billion
text: Setback for Byju’s: BlackRock , the world's largest asset manager, has significantly reduced the estimated value of edtech firm Byju's to around $1 billion. This marks a decline of over 95% from its valuation of $22 billion during its last fundraising round in October 2022.In a regulatory filing with the US Securities and Exchange Commission on January 5, BlackRock disclosed that it has marked down the value of its shares in Byju's for the third time in 2023. The shares were valued at $209.57 each for the quarter ended October, implying a valuation of approximately $1 billion for Byju's. This is a significant decrease from its valuation of $8.2 billion at the end of the March quarter. At its peak in 2022, each share was valued at $4,660, said an ET report.BlackRock holds less than a 1% stake in Byju's.Byju's, headquartered in Bengaluru, has experienced a notable decline in its operations and is currently exploring the sale of group assets to address its debt. The company's founder, Byju Raveendran , has faced challenges in securing new financing, leading to delays in salary payments for employees in November and other operational difficulties. Raveendran recently assured a group of senior employees that the cash shortage should be resolved within the next 45-60 days.In November, Prosus, a Dutch investor, also marked down its valuation of Byju's to under $3 billion, compared to the $5.1 billion valuation assigned in March of the previous year. Prosus holds slightly less than a 10% stake in the edtech firm.Crossover investment funds periodically reassess the valuations of their investments, taking into account various factors, including the valuation of comparable companies in the public market.Byju's has faced scrutiny for delays in reporting its financial results and allegations of questionable business practices, including the alleged mis-selling of courses. Additionally, the company is currently in negotiations with its term loan B lenders. There are also concerns over alleged violations of the Foreign Exchange Management Act, as the Enforcement Directorate has issued notices to Byju's.According to a report by ET on December 22, Byju's' consolidated loss at its parent company, Think and Learn, is estimated to have exceeded Rs 8,200 crore in the fiscal year 2021-22, with revenue surpassing Rs 5,000 crore. Approximately half of the loss is attributed to the write-off of its subsidiary, Whitehat Jr, which was acquired for $300 million in 2020.TechCrunch, a US news publication, was the first to report on BlackRock's markdown of Byju's valuation .Investors have demanded that Byju's promptly release its audited financial results for 2022-23 before considering any further investments in the company.Once regarded as India's most valued startup, Byju's has faced challenges in meeting staff salary obligations while actively seeking buyers for its group assets, such as Epic and Great Learning.
summary:
Setback for Byju’s: BlackRock , the world's largest asset manager, has significantly reduced the estimated value of edtech firm Byju's to around $1 billion.
The shares were valued at $209.57 each for the quarter ended October, implying a valuation of approximately $1 billion for Byju's.
This is a significant decrease from its valuation of $8.2 billion at the end of the March quarter.
The company's founder, Byju Raveendran , has faced challenges in securing new financing, leading to delays in salary payments for employees in November and other operational difficulties.
Raveendran recently assured a group of senior employees that the cash shortage should be resolved within the next 45-60 days.In November, Prosus, a Dutch investor, also marked down its valuation of Byju's to under $3 billion, compared to the $5.1 billion valuation assigned in March of the previous year.

title: Bombay HC: PIL on mechanism for Living Will raises good public cause, seeks reply from govt, civic body in 6 weeks
text: MUMBAI: Bombay high court on Friday observed orally that a city doctor has raised a “good public cause ’’ in his petition seeking judicial intervention to ensure that the government sets up as directed by the Supreme Court, a mechanism for living wills (LW)-- Advanced Medical Directive, by a citizen.The LW allows patients who don’t want invasive treatments in case of any eventuality to instruct the path they wish to opt for.The HC sought replies from the Maharashtra government, BrihanMumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) and Central government in six weeks in response to the Public interest litigation ( PIL ) and posted it for further hearing in February.A gynaecologist, Dr Nikhil Datar, had filed the PIL to highlight the lack of mechanism and mandated infrastructure in terms of a ‘custodian' being appointed to ensure enforcement of a January 2023 order of the SC.The SC had, last year, bringing closure to a 2005 petition, directed the creation of a mechanism to give effect to citizens’ right to die with dignity through execution of advanced medical directives.A division bench of Chief Justice Devendra Kumar Upadhyaya and Justice Arif Doctor said to the civic counsel, “it is a good public cause. The SC has already passed directions.’’Dr Datar, 53, among the first to notarise aliving will in the city, was arguing in person, before the HC. The PIL has two assistant professors from Maharashtra National Law School, Mumbai, Drs Anand Raut, 37 from Amravati and Garima Pal, 34 from Mumbai, both as co-petitioners.Submitting that it is the “duty of every citizen to make a living will,’’ Dr Datar sought directions from the HC to enforce the obligation cast on civic bodies, local government to appoint a custodian and for nomination of one doctor to be a member of a ‘secondary board’ envisaged to be part of the mechanism.He said he had notarised his LW on February, 23, 2023 and sent a copy by registered post to the civic chief asking him to nominate a custodian for its safe keep. He later last July, with no revert from BMC, even filed an application under the Right to Information Act (RTI) Act for name of the official, but till filing of the petition, said he received no “concrete information so far.’’The HC observed in its order that State government pleader PP Kakade and the civic advocate waive notice and it took on record the appearance of a lawyer who normally appears for the Centre.The PIL said on January 24, 2023, the SC had modified its 2018 order “to make the procedure of removal (withholding) of life support from terminally ill patients and doctors by limiting the role played by government officials.’’The SC judgment had said, “A copy shall be handed over to the competent officer of the local government or municipality or panchayat…the authorities shall nominate a competent official …to be the custodian of the document (LW).’’ The SC said the executor of the Living Will “may also choose to incorporate their Advance Directive as part of the digital health records, if any.’’Dr Datar said he hence made the union Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, a party to the PIL.
summary:
MUMBAI: Bombay high court on Friday observed orally that a city doctor has raised a “good public cause ’’ in his petition seeking judicial intervention to ensure that the government sets up as directed by the Supreme Court, a mechanism for living wills (LW)-- Advanced Medical Directive, by a citizen.The LW allows patients who don’t want invasive treatments in case of any eventuality to instruct the path they wish to opt for.The HC sought replies from the Maharashtra government, BrihanMumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) and Central government in six weeks in response to the Public interest litigation ( PIL ) and posted it for further hearing in February.A gynaecologist, Dr Nikhil Datar, had filed the PIL to highlight the lack of mechanism and mandated infrastructure in terms of a ‘custodian' being appointed to ensure enforcement of a January 2023 order of the SC.The SC had, last year, bringing closure to a 2005 petition, directed the creation of a mechanism to give effect to citizens’ right to die with dignity through execution of advanced medical directives.A division bench of Chief Justice Devendra Kumar Upadhyaya and Justice Arif Doctor said to the civic counsel, “it is a good public cause.
The SC has already passed directions.’’Dr Datar, 53, among the first to notarise aliving will in the city, was arguing in person, before the HC.
The PIL has two assistant professors from Maharashtra National Law School, Mumbai, Drs Anand Raut, 37 from Amravati and Garima Pal, 34 from Mumbai, both as co-petitioners.Submitting that it is the “duty of every citizen to make a living will,’’ Dr Datar sought directions from the HC to enforce the obligation cast on civic bodies, local government to appoint a custodian and for nomination of one doctor to be a member of a ‘secondary board’ envisaged to be part of the mechanism.He said he had notarised his LW on February, 23, 2023 and sent a copy by registered post to the civic chief asking him to nominate a custodian for its safe keep.
He later last July, with no revert from BMC, even filed an application under the Right to Information Act (RTI) Act for name of the official, but till filing of the petition, said he received no “concrete information so far.’’The HC observed in its order that State government pleader PP Kakade and the civic advocate waive notice and it took on record the appearance of a lawyer who normally appears for the Centre.The PIL said on January 24, 2023, the SC had modified its 2018 order “to make the procedure of removal (withholding) of life support from terminally ill patients and doctors by limiting the role played by government officials.’’The SC judgment had said, “A copy shall be handed over to the competent officer of the local government or municipality or panchayat…the authorities shall nominate a competent official …to be the custodian of the document (LW).’’ The SC said the executor of the Living Will “may also choose to incorporate their Advance Directive as part of the digital health records, if any.’’Dr Datar said he hence made the union Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, a party to the PIL.
