title: US, UK defend Yemen bombings as ally Israel faces Gaza genocide charges
text:
Jan 12, 2024, 01:42PM IST

Source: TOI.in

As many as 44 countries expressed consensus to stop Houthi attacks on Red Sea vessels. Several governments issued joint statements urging an immediate halt to illegal attacks and warning of accountability for those threatening lives and global commerce. Despite warnings, Houthi attacks in the Red Sea continued, involving missiles and one-way attack aerial vehicles targeting U.S. and UK vessels. In response to Houthi attacks, the armed forces of the U.S. and UK, supported by the Netherlands, Canada, Bahrain, and Australia, conducted joint strikes in Houthi-controlled areas of Yemen. The joint strikes were carried out in accordance with the inherent right of individual and collective self-defense, consistent with the UN Charter.
summary:
Jan 12, 2024, 01:42PM ISTSource: TOI.inAs many as 44 countries expressed consensus to stop Houthi attacks on Red Sea vessels.
Several governments issued joint statements urging an immediate halt to illegal attacks and warning of accountability for those threatening lives and global commerce.
Despite warnings, Houthi attacks in the Red Sea continued, involving missiles and one-way attack aerial vehicles targeting U.S. and UK vessels.
In response to Houthi attacks, the armed forces of the U.S. and UK, supported by the Netherlands, Canada, Bahrain, and Australia, conducted joint strikes in Houthi-controlled areas of Yemen.
The joint strikes were carried out in accordance with the inherent right of individual and collective self-defense, consistent with the UN Charter.

title: Iran strongly condemns US-UK military strikes in Yemen, calls it violation of sovereignty
text:
Jan 12, 2024, 01:30PM IST

Source: TOI.in

Iran strongly denounces the military strikes by the US and Britain in Yemen, branding them as arbitrary violations of sovereignty. Cities, including Sana'a, Hudaydah, Sa’ada, and Dhamar, witnessed explosions, with confirmed involvement from the US and Britain. Nasser Kan’ani, Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesman, decries the attacks as clear breaches of international laws, intensifying regional insecurity. He links the strikes to US and UK support for alleged Israeli war crimes against Palestinians during the Gaza conflict. Expressing concern, Kan’ani calls for responsible international reactions to curb the spread of war and insecurity. President Joe Biden characterizes the airstrikes as defensive, with a commitment to further action if needed. These attacks align with Israel's contentious military campaign in Gaza, facing resistance and economic costs. Yemeni armed forces targeting Israeli ships contribute to the invasion's economic impact. The US-led aggression coincides with hearings at the International Court of Justice, where Israel faces charges of genocide in Gaza. Observers anticipate potential repercussions for the West, particularly the US and Britain, due to their alleged support for the invasion. Iran underscores the attacks' potential consequences for regional and global peace.
summary:
Jan 12, 2024, 01:30PM ISTSource: TOI.inIran strongly denounces the military strikes by the US and Britain in Yemen, branding them as arbitrary violations of sovereignty.
Nasser Kan’ani, Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesman, decries the attacks as clear breaches of international laws, intensifying regional insecurity.
He links the strikes to US and UK support for alleged Israeli war crimes against Palestinians during the Gaza conflict.
Observers anticipate potential repercussions for the West, particularly the US and Britain, due to their alleged support for the invasion.
Iran underscores the attacks' potential consequences for regional and global peace.

title: Pak's Chinese-Origin J-10C fighter jets test operational readiness, hold joint aerial exercise with Qatar's Eurofighter Typhoons
text:
Jan 12, 2024, 01:10PM IST

Source: TOI.in

Pakistan's recently inducted Chinese-origin J-10C fighter jets participated in joint aerial exercises with Qatar's Eurofighter Typhoons. This marks the inaugural instance of the J-10C aircraft being tested in a major aerial exercise, as reported by the Eurasian Times. The joint air exercises, named Zilzal-II, began on January 10, 2024, and are hosted by Qatar. The exercises aim to simulate realistic aerial combat scenarios, testing the operational readiness of both the Pakistan Air Force (PAF) and the Qatar Emiri Air Force.
summary:
Jan 12, 2024, 01:10PM ISTSource: TOI.inPakistan's recently inducted Chinese-origin J-10C fighter jets participated in joint aerial exercises with Qatar's Eurofighter Typhoons.
This marks the inaugural instance of the J-10C aircraft being tested in a major aerial exercise, as reported by the Eurasian Times.
The joint air exercises, named Zilzal-II, began on January 10, 2024, and are hosted by Qatar.
The exercises aim to simulate realistic aerial combat scenarios, testing the operational readiness of both the Pakistan Air Force (PAF) and the Qatar Emiri Air Force.

title: Here is where you can watch Guntur Kaaram on OTT after its satellite release
text:
South Buzz: Mumbai police file an FIR against Nayanthara’s ‘Annapoorani’; ‘Devara’ first glimpse garners massive responses; Netizens share mixed reviews on Jayaram’s ‘Abraham Ozler’

In a country like India where movies are produced on such a large scale, certain films create waves even before getting released or during their announcement. One such electrifying entry is ' Guntur Kaaram ,' marking the third collaboration between the charismatic Mahesh Babu and the innovative director Trivikram Srinivas . This cinematic masterpiece has become the talk of the town, so it is apt to acquire its telecast or streaming rights.Gemini TV, a well-known brand in television entertainment, has wisely secured satellite rights, which is a smart move, as it is likely to get higher viewership because of the intensity of the film as well, and we also enjoy watching our favourite superstar in character again and again.It comes after the film's digital rights were quickly acquired by streaming giant Netflix, indicating a big move into the OTT platform arena.While 'Guntur Kaaram' had surpassed $1 million in pre-release sales on its own, this incredible amount isn't just a figure; it's evidence of Mahesh Babu's captivating charisma and the film's undeniable buzz and shows its magnitude and anticipation among fans for an experience that has to come.In the film, 'Guntur Kaaram' presents Mahesh Babu in all action, but he isn't the only one in the limelight. The gorgeous Sreeleela looks stunning on screen as the main character, giving her character richness and energy. Meenakshi Chaudhary,Rao Ramesh , Prakash Raj, Jagapathi Babu , Ramya Krishnan, Easwari Rao, and Vennela Kishore are among the cast members that create this film's unique flair, making it an engaging watch.The film's music is produced by the talented Thaman, whose works are sure to make you cry and get your pulse rate high as you feel the action.Guntur Kaaram' is more like a festival being released during the Pongal festival itself and a celebration of skill, story, and beautiful cinematography that promises thrills, emotions, and moments that will stick with them long after the film ends.
summary:

This cinematic masterpiece has become the talk of the town, so it is apt to acquire its telecast or streaming rights.Gemini TV, a well-known brand in television entertainment, has wisely secured satellite rights, which is a smart move, as it is likely to get higher viewership because of the intensity of the film as well, and we also enjoy watching our favourite superstar in character again and again.It comes after the film's digital rights were quickly acquired by streaming giant Netflix, indicating a big move into the OTT platform arena.While 'Guntur Kaaram' had surpassed $1 million in pre-release sales on its own, this incredible amount isn't just a figure; it's evidence of Mahesh Babu's captivating charisma and the film's undeniable buzz and shows its magnitude and anticipation among fans for an experience that has to come.In the film, 'Guntur Kaaram' presents Mahesh Babu in all action, but he isn't the only one in the limelight.
The gorgeous Sreeleela looks stunning on screen as the main character, giving her character richness and energy.
Meenakshi Chaudhary,Rao Ramesh , Prakash Raj, Jagapathi Babu , Ramya Krishnan, Easwari Rao, and Vennela Kishore are among the cast members that create this film's unique flair, making it an engaging watch.The film's music is produced by the talented Thaman, whose works are sure to make you cry and get your pulse rate high as you feel the action.Guntur Kaaram' is more like a festival being released during the Pongal festival itself and a celebration of skill, story, and beautiful cinematography that promises thrills, emotions, and moments that will stick with them long after the film ends.

title: L'Oréal's next-gen hair dryer uses infrared light to dry up your hair
text: L'Oréal , the cosmetics maker, has introduced AirLight Pro , its unique take on the traditional hair dryer , at the CES 2024 , which uses infrared light instead of heating coils to dry up hair.AirLight Pro uses a combination of infrared-light technology and wind , which L'Oréal says provides smoother, more hydrated hair while also drying them faster. Not just that, but this hair dryer also uses up to 31 percent less energy than traditional heat-coil hair dryers, and that is because of the optimised heat flow across multiple hair types.The hair dryer is inspired by the natural process of drying rain.After the rain, wind and sun are the most effective combination to dry out the environment. Guive Balooch, the global vice president of L’Oréal’s Technology Incubator, explains that the same principle can be applied to hair drying. By using a mix of infrared light and powerful airflow, it mimics the effects of the sun and wind, reducing the need for direct heat.Inside the hair dryer, there is a circle of infrared lights powered by tungsten—halogen bulbs, including a smaller circle that generates air. These infrared lights help to dry the water droplets on the surface of the hair while keeping the moisture within the strand.Balooch explains that different wavelengths of infrared light have varying effects on the hair. For example, the red/yellow end of the spectrum is similar to UV light, which is not ideal for hair. In contrast, blue and purple light provides a more hydrating effect. The result is a 30 percent faster drying time and a 31 percent reduction in energy usage, resulting in 59 percent visually smoother and 33 percent more hydrated hair.L'Oréal says that it has tested the AirLight Pro on more than 500 people with multiple hair types.The hair dryer has an app of its own that allows users to customise their heat preferences. Additionally, a set of smart attachments will be included, such as a diffuser and a concentrator nozzle. So, when you attach one of these accessories, the hairdryer will automatically recognize it and adjust the speed and temperature accordingly.The Fairlight Pro is designed in partnership with the startup Zuvi, in which L'Oreal has a minority investment through its corporate venture fund. Zuvi itself sells a $260 Halo Hair Dryer, which uses the LightCare technology found in the AirLight Pro. Balooch explains that the AirLight Pro is the result of combining the knowledge of L'Oréal, which has expertise in the biology of skin and hair, as well as many well-known brands, with Zuvi's technology.AirLight Pro will be available in select markets, including the US and Europe, under the L’Oréal Professionnel's brand for both beauty professionals and consumers in 2024. It will retail for "under $400."
summary:
L'Oréal , the cosmetics maker, has introduced AirLight Pro , its unique take on the traditional hair dryer , at the CES 2024 , which uses infrared light instead of heating coils to dry up hair.AirLight Pro uses a combination of infrared-light technology and wind , which L'Oréal says provides smoother, more hydrated hair while also drying them faster.
Guive Balooch, the global vice president of L’Oréal’s Technology Incubator, explains that the same principle can be applied to hair drying.
These infrared lights help to dry the water droplets on the surface of the hair while keeping the moisture within the strand.Balooch explains that different wavelengths of infrared light have varying effects on the hair.
For example, the red/yellow end of the spectrum is similar to UV light, which is not ideal for hair.
Zuvi itself sells a $260 Halo Hair Dryer, which uses the LightCare technology found in the AirLight Pro.

title: Karnataka News: Gang-raped for interfaith affair, Karnataka woman tells court
text: HAVERI: A Karnataka woman who was allegedly hounded by seven men from her community over an interfaith relationship told a judicial magistrate on Thursday that she was gang-raped by the group that barged into her hotel room in Hangal taluk, 80km from Hubli, four days ago.The complainant, who was with her male companion at the time, said she was dragged to a forested area near Nalkuru Cross of Hangal and sexually assaulted by all seven men. Her companion was allegedly beaten up.A separate video statement of her plight is also circulating on the social media."I pleaded with folded hands, but they were in no mood to listen. Three of them later dropped me at a bus stop, from where I reached my home," the woman said. "I don't know their names, but will be able to identify them if paraded before me."Three of the seven suspects - identified as Aftab Maqbul Ahmed Chandanakatti, Madarasab Mohammad Isak Mandakki, and Abdul Khader Jafersab Hanchinamani - were arrested on Thursday. SP Anshu Srivastava confirmed that the survivor's account, as recorded by the magistrate, matched her video statement to the media.Based on the new information, what was a case of alleged moral policing will now be treated as a serious crime. "We are recasting the FIR that was initially filed, based on information available at the time. We will invoke Section 376D (rape by one or more people with common intention) against the accused," SP said.SP Srivastava also assured the survivor and her family of police protection.
summary:
Her companion was allegedly beaten up.A separate video statement of her plight is also circulating on the social media.
Three of them later dropped me at a bus stop, from where I reached my home," the woman said.
"Three of the seven suspects - identified as Aftab Maqbul Ahmed Chandanakatti, Madarasab Mohammad Isak Mandakki, and Abdul Khader Jafersab Hanchinamani - were arrested on Thursday.
"We are recasting the FIR that was initially filed, based on information available at the time.
We will invoke Section 376D (rape by one or more people with common intention) against the accused," SP said.SP Srivastava also assured the survivor and her family of police protection.

Merry Christmas movie review and release LIVE Updates: 'Both Katrina Kaif and Vijay Sethupathi have elevated the writing with their performances the movie' - Sriram Raghavan

'Merry Christmas' finally hits the silver screen today, January 12! The Sriram Raghavan directorial, described as "a genre-defying tale" will release nationwide today, giving fans a thrilling start to the new year 2024. Shot in two languages, the film features two distinct supporting casts. The Hindi version boasts a cast including Sanjay Kapoor, Vinay Pathak, Pratima Kannan, and Tinnu Anand, while the Tamil rendition stars Radhika Sarathkumar, Shanmugaraja, Kevin Jay Babu, and Rajesh Williams in equivalent roles.The film also marks Katrina's first on-screen collaboration with Vijay. The actress, a prominent figure in the Hindi film industry, expressed her enthusiasm working with Vijay and declared the South star as "the best performer." Sharing insights into their collaboration, she commended, "Sriram sir gave the actors a lot of space before the shoot, and we had a lot of discussion. When I watched the final result, what I saw between Vijay and my character was surprising."Vijay reciprocated the praise, acknowledging Katrina's industry experience and applauding her collaborative and open-minded approach on set. At a press conference, the actor recalled, "I met her first time in Sriram sir's office and as soon as she entered the office there was such a healthy conversation. She likes to discuss more and listen more. There was a better understanding between us on the set. So much I gained and learned from her."Ahead of the January 12 release, the makers held a star-studded premiere, which was attended by b-town stars including Vicky Kaushal, Sunny Kaushal, Sharvari Wagh, Neha Dhupia, Kabir Khan, Aditya Roy Kapur, Ananya Panday, Radhika Madan, Shanaya Kapoor, and Khushi Kapoor, among others. Originally slated for a December release, the film's promotional campaign included captivating posters, an engaging trailer, and melodious songs, with the latest addition being the soul-stirring romantic love song 'Raat Akeli Thi,' unveiled online on Wednesday.Anticipation now surrounds the box office performance with initial predictions hinting at a nett collection or Rs 2 crore across India on its opening day, spanning both languages. Notably, there is speculation about the potential of this performance marking a significant moment for Katrina Kaif, potentially challenging her lowest opening in a decade, a record currently held by her 2022 release, 'Phone Bhoot'.The film's release timing adds an extra layer of intrigue, considering the historical challenges associated with January releases. While many inaugural January releases in the past 15 years have struggled at the box office, exceptions like Vicky Kaushal's 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' and Ajay Devgn's 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' offer hope for 'Merry Christmas' as it stands as a solo release in the market. This positioning could allow the film to leverage positive word of mouth, paving the way for a successful opening weekend and an extended run in theaters.Read Less

title: Merry Christmas Review: Sriram Raghavan's unwraps a neo-noir surprise in this twisted tale
text: Back in town after being away for seven years, a man spends Christmas Eve with a mysterious and lonely woman. The evening takes an unexpected and dark turn that could land him in trouble.Thanks to consuming riveting suspense thrillers and crime dramas relentlessly, audiences can often easily predict twists or crack a mystery. But not with Sriram Raghavan’s movies, and his latest offering is no different. Here, the director not only keeps the suspense veiled, but one can also not foretell what’s going to happen next.The movie begins with Albert (Vijay Sethupathi) returning home to an empty house as his mother passes while he is away for seven years. As his neighbour (Tinu Anand) describes her last few days, Albert decides to step out and take in the Christmas cheer to lift his spirits up. When he helps an attractive woman, Maria (Katrina Kaif), take her mute daughter home, she invites him in for a drink, and sparks fly between them. However, things go awry soon, and the narrative turns into a whodunnit. But the movie is more than that. Maria and the incident remain shrouded in mystery when in comes Ronnie (Sanjay Kapoor), adding to the chaos.The movie is quintessentially Raghavanesque and neo-noir in its tonality. It springs surprises that you least expect, and therein lies his ingenuity. However, not much happens in the film’s first half, and the real action begins only shortly before the intermission. The track of the two strangers spending the evening together overstretches, and the audience’s interest intermittently tapers.The narrative takes wings in the second half and keeps you engrossed right until the end. When you think all’s well that ends well, another track begins. The twist does not seem incongruous but adds another layer to the narrative.Vijay Sethupathi, as the earnest Albert, is outstanding. He delivers funny lines with an effortless poker face. “Fermented kuchh bhi chalega, except dosa batter,” he says to Katrina Kaif’s Maria. A story within the story is as quirky, and Vijay narrates it with finesse. Katrina Kaif delivers a serviceable performance and is excellent in a scene where she lets herself go and celebrates Christmas Eve with Albert. Sanjay Kapoor, Tinu Anand, and Vinay Pathak (as a cop) play their parts well.Pritam’s soundtrack (especially Raat Akeli Thi and Nazar Teri Toofan) and Daniel B George’s background score enhance the film’s moody atmosphere, masterfully created by cinematographer Madhu Neelkandan. Bombay, when railway stations had weighing scales with whirring little discs, has been recreated splendidly. The film’s dialogues also stand out. When Albert points out to Maria that she and her husband look happy in the pictures, despite there being trouble in paradise, she says, “Tum kisiko jaante ho jo rota chehra deewar par lagaate hain?” (Who frames photos in which they look sad?).Although relatively less ominous compared to films in the genre or the director’s previous works, catch this one for the wicked plot and the surprises. You’d have a merry time!Also See: Merry Christmas movie review and release LIVE Updates
summary:
Back in town after being away for seven years, a man spends Christmas Eve with a mysterious and lonely woman.
When he helps an attractive woman, Maria (Katrina Kaif), take her mute daughter home, she invites him in for a drink, and sparks fly between them.
When you think all’s well that ends well, another track begins.
Katrina Kaif delivers a serviceable performance and is excellent in a scene where she lets herself go and celebrates Christmas Eve with Albert.
You’d have a merry time!Also See: Merry Christmas movie review and release LIVE Updates

title: Columbia Jackets For Women: Top 10 Picks for Columbia Jackets for Women

Women's Benton Springs Printed Full Zip

This jacket is perfect for the colder months as it is made from 100% polyester and features an interior drawcord for a customizable fit. This imported jacket is machine washable and easy to take care of, so you don’t have to worry about it ruining your winter wardrobe.

Women's Bugaboo Ii Fleece Interchange Jacket

Get all the versatility and warmth you need for your winter adventures with the Columbia women's Bugaboo Interchange Jacket. From Black to Aqua Haze to Faded Peach, this jacket has it all. It comes in a variety of colors and sizes, so you can find the perfect fit for you. It's made of 100% Polyester and 100% Nylon and features Columbia's patented Omi-heat technology - the metal dot pattern inside the lining keeps your body warm and the breathable fabric keeps you cool. It's waterproof and breathable. It's a classic 3-in-1 design. You can set it up for different winter weather or just wear each layer separately. It's got a removable hood and critical seam-seal construction for maximum protection.

Women's Copper Crest Hooded Jacket

Get ready for the chillier days of winter with the Copper Crest hooded jacket from Columbia. It's made from 100% polyester. It includes a super smooth and quilted shell with an insulated interior. Plus, it comes in a range of colors, from Dark Nocturnal to Aqua Haze and Black. You can get it in X-Small or 3X sizes, so you can find the perfect fit for you. It's designed with comfort in mind, so you'll be able to stay warm no matter what the weather is like. It's made with worry-free and fleece-based construction, so it'll last for years to come.

Women's Fire Side Ii Sherpa Full Zip

Take a break from the cold weather and try out the luxuries of the Columbia Fire Side II Shermanpa full zip jacket. It's made from 100% polyester and features an extra plush and velvety sherpa pile. The cushioned collar and hem make it easy to stay warm and the zipper-up design lets you lock in your comfort. Plus, it comes in a wide range of colors, from Shark to Aqua Haze and Dark Sapphire. It's perfect for fall and winter activities and you can wear it as a mid-layer or an outer layer. And don't forget the two zippers - they keep your hands warm and your essentials safe. Get ready to elevate your winter wardrobe!

Women's Panorama Long Jacket

Stay warm and stylish this winter with the perfect Panorama Jacket from Columbia Women's. It is available in a range of elegant colors, from Chalk and Dusty Pink to 3X and X-Small. This jacket has everything you need to stay cozy and comfortable. It's made from a super soft 100% polymer shell, so it's tough enough to wear every day while still being lightweight. Winter is here, and it’s time to get ready for it! The Columbia Women’s Suttle Mountain long insulated jacket is designed to keep you warm, comfortable, and durable. title: Deepotsav: Deepotsav and Fireworks at Saryu Ghat
text:
Ram Temple in Ayodhya: Sanctum sanctorum ready for consecration ceremony, says temple trust

The Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Trust announces completion of the Ram Temple in Ayodhya. The consecration ceremony is scheduled for January 22 and will be attended by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The temple will open for devotees on January 24.

Muslim poet from MP invited to Ram temple consecration ceremony in Ayodhya

Visually impaired Muslim bhajan singer Akbar Taj joyfully accepts invitation to Ayodhya's Ram temple consecration ceremony on January 22. Taj, from Madhya Pradesh, will recite his poems dedicated to Lord Ram. Despite financial challenges, Taj prioritizes this event and expresses gratitude for the invitation.

Ayodhya Ram temple: Lucknow University professor among 10 priests to conduct consecration rituals

Shyamlesh Kumar Tiwari, an assistant professor at Lucknow University, has been selected to be one of the 10 priests conducting the 'Pran Pratishtha' of the Ram Lalla idol at the Ayodhya Ram Temple from January 16 to January 22.

Lucknow: Deepotsav and fireworks at Saryu ghat will mark the consecration ceremony at Ayodhya on January 22.The state government has requested for a ‘deepotsav’ at every house, ghat and temple in Ayodhya the same day. The information department will put up 50 extra screens for live screening of the ceremony.Divisional commissioner, Ayodhya, Gaurav Dayal said that a special cleanliness drive will be conducted in offices to keep them clean and free of plastic.The offices will also get special lighting arrangements. Ram ki Pairi will be cleaned. The medical facilities in Ayodhya will also be upgraded. Irrigation department will construct a 1.3-km barrier on the river. The urban development department has been asked to ensure cleanliness of public toilets on the lines of the Kumbh mela.Water coolers will be installed at 50 prominent spots. As many as 250 police guides will be deployed to help people with information that they need. Digital tourist app will be launched on January 14. Lost and found centres and help desks will be set up at bus stations, railway stations, airports, parking and other important locations. Traffic sign boards are being put up at important roads to help people. Information department will give 50 more LED vehicles in urban and rural areas. In every temple, Ram sankirtan will be held from January 14 till January 22.We also published the following articles recently
summary:
Ram Temple in Ayodhya: Sanctum sanctorum ready for consecration ceremony, says temple trustThe Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Trust announces completion of the Ram Temple in Ayodhya.
The consecration ceremony is scheduled for January 22 and will be attended by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
Muslim poet from MP invited to Ram temple consecration ceremony in AyodhyaVisually impaired Muslim bhajan singer Akbar Taj joyfully accepts invitation to Ayodhya's Ram temple consecration ceremony on January 22.
Lucknow: Deepotsav and fireworks at Saryu ghat will mark the consecration ceremony at Ayodhya on January 22.The state government has requested for a ‘deepotsav’ at every house, ghat and temple in Ayodhya the same day.
In every temple, Ram sankirtan will be held from January 14 till January 22.We also published the following articles recently

title: Ayodhya airport to follow ‘drop-and-move’ policy on January 22
text: LUCKNOW: In view of the fact that the newly inaugurated Ayodhya airport will witness an unprecedented rush on January 22 when the Pran Pratishtha ceremony takes place at the Ram temple , concerned officials have decided to adopt the ‘drop-and-move’ policy.Airports Authority of India (AAI) engineering in-charge and project director Ayodhya Airport Rajeev Kulshreshta said, "We have completed all the civil and technical work inside the airport and only final touches are being given to the rest of the work.However, on January 22 only about 100 flights (coming and going) would be accommodated. The airport is meticulously managing the influx of these flights, mostly of VVIPs, by allocating tight time slots for both landing and take-off, necessitating efficient coordination to avoid congestion. It would be a drop-and-move affair for all the aircraft as we have limited parking facilities in Ayodhya.”The Ayodhya airport is preparing to handle the January 22 rush on a war footing. Requests for more than 200 flights (chartered and private) have been received by the airport authorities but only about 110 can be accommodated on that day.A senior official of the Airports Authority of India (AAI) said, “Ayodhya airport is gearing up to handle more than 100 flights (coming and going included) on January 22, with over 200 flight requests pouring in, comprising both chartered and private flights.”Director, Ayodhya airport Vinod Kumar said, “To handle the overflow, designated parking spaces in nearby airports such as Prayagraj, Kushinagar, Varanasi and Gorakhpur are being utilized. All these aircraft have been given parking slots at different nearby airports like Varanasi, Gorakhpur, Kushinagar and Prayagraj. This strategic approach aims to alleviate the pressure on Ayodhya airport, ensuring a smooth flow of air traffic.”An official of Air Traffic Control said on condition of anonymity, “Strict adherence to allocated time slots is crucial, as any delay in reaching the airport on time may lead to the cancellation of landing permission or, at least result, in extended wait time in airspace.”This comprehensive preparation reflects the airport’s ability to manage the flight operations effectively, at the same time safeguarding operational efficiency and minimizing disruptions during this anticipated rush on January 22.He said, "The airport has a 2,200 metres long and 45 metres wide runway which can handle landing and take-off of Airbus A320, ATR-72 and Bombardier private jets. In the second phase the airport would be opened for international flights with the expansion of the runway to 3,200 metres. For night landing, we have IFR (Instrument Flight Rules) and CAT-1 landing facility for landing during fog. Under CAT I facility, the aircraft can land even when the visibility is as low as 60 metres.”The 848-metre-long threshold has also been created which is in addition to the 2,200-metre-long runway. For commercial aircraft operations from Ayodhya airport, the runway has Doppler Very High Frequency Omni Range (DVOR), a homing gate system which is a standard International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO) ground-based radio navigational aid besides having Instrument Landing System (ILS).This is the most modern technology used for giving information to aircraft to define air traffic control routes for landing and take-off and its further journey.This technology helps in terminal and instrument approach and departure procedures of the aircraft.However, an official of Lucknow’s Chaudhary Singh Airport said, “The airport has received the orders to make arrangements for parking of 15 aircraft on January 22.”According to an Airport Authority of India (AAI) official source, the staff is especially trained to handle the air traffic. They are trained to welcome the VVIPs and bring them to their designated lounge or vehicles.
summary:
The airport is meticulously managing the influx of these flights, mostly of VVIPs, by allocating tight time slots for both landing and take-off, necessitating efficient coordination to avoid congestion.
It would be a drop-and-move affair for all the aircraft as we have limited parking facilities in Ayodhya.”The Ayodhya airport is preparing to handle the January 22 rush on a war footing.
All these aircraft have been given parking slots at different nearby airports like Varanasi, Gorakhpur, Kushinagar and Prayagraj.
In the second phase the airport would be opened for international flights with the expansion of the runway to 3,200 metres.
For night landing, we have IFR (Instrument Flight Rules) and CAT-1 landing facility for landing during fog.

title: Times Square's billboard to feature Ram temple consecration ceremony
text: AYODHYA/LUCKNOW: The Pran Pratishtha ceremony of Ram Lalla in Ayodhya is anticipated to resonate globally, with Yogi Adityanath government officials collaborating with national agencies and the ministry of information and broadcasting. They are actively identifying key locations for coverage on January 21 and 22.A senior official highlighted meticulous preparations, including strategically placing cameramen across the city for comprehensive coverage.Concurrently, rallies and shows supporting the temple are scheduled in California, Washington, New York, Chicago, and various European and Canadian cities. The Times Square billboard will also feature the event to attract a vast audience.Iconic global landmarks like the Eiffel Tower in Paris and Times Square in New York are expected to draw large crowds tuning into the ceremony. Parisian viewers will experience the event in the early morning, while those in New York will gather around midnight for this grand spectacle.The live broadcast of the celebrations will be disseminated worldwide. On January 22, followers of Lord Ram can participate in the ceremony from anywhere, as the event will be showcased by the national broadcaster and accessible online, he added. VHP office-bearers shared that the Hindu community, dispersed across 160 countries, will joyously celebrate on January 22.
summary:
AYODHYA/LUCKNOW: The Pran Pratishtha ceremony of Ram Lalla in Ayodhya is anticipated to resonate globally, with Yogi Adityanath government officials collaborating with national agencies and the ministry of information and broadcasting.
The Times Square billboard will also feature the event to attract a vast audience.Iconic global landmarks like the Eiffel Tower in Paris and Times Square in New York are expected to draw large crowds tuning into the ceremony.
Parisian viewers will experience the event in the early morning, while those in New York will gather around midnight for this grand spectacle.The live broadcast of the celebrations will be disseminated worldwide.
On January 22, followers of Lord Ram can participate in the ceremony from anywhere, as the event will be showcased by the national broadcaster and accessible online, he added.
VHP office-bearers shared that the Hindu community, dispersed across 160 countries, will joyously celebrate on January 22.

title: Cm: Ram Bhakts Can Experience Sight Of Treta Yug In Ayodhya
text:
Six lakh got govt jobs in past 6 years: CM

Ayodhya Ram temple design is disabled-friendly

BJP's Divyang cell state unit president Om Prakash claimed that the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya will be a "Divyang-friendly temple". Provisions are being made at the under-construction temple to help disabled persons with easy access. The temple complex will have facilities like lifts and ramps at the entrance to ensure accessibility for Divyangs. BJP focuses on empowering Divyangs and mobilizing them for the upcoming Lok Sabha polls, recognizing their potential in forming the government.

LUCKNOW: Terming Uttar Pradesh as one of the most progressive states in the country, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said that nepotism and caste-based politics under previous governments had created an identity crisis for residents in the past but today people from the state are greeted with happiness and respect.Speaking on Ram temple, Yogi said that under previous governments, people hesitated to talk about Ayodhya but the BJP government brought about a significant transformation in the temple town.“The struggle of 500 years has come to an end. Today, the entire world is eager to visit Ayodhya. The infrastructure, including road, air, and rail connectivity, has seen remarkable improvement. In the new UP of New India, devotees of Lord Ram can experience the sacred sight of Treta Yug in Ayodhya ,” he added.Addressing the Viksit Bharat Sankalp Yatra in Bareilly, where he also inaugurated and laid foundation stones for 170 projects worth Rs 3,405 crore, the CM said, “Under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, every citizen of the country feels secure, and every eligible individual is getting benefits of public welfare schemes without discrimination.”“Significant development initiatives are being implemented on the ground, positioning India as a global leader. It is a matter of pride for 140 crore people of the country that the world is now looking up to new India,” the CM said. Describing the change in UP after he took over as CM in 2017, Yogi said that earlier curfews would be imposed for months but now grand Kanwar Yatras were taken out. “Now, curfew is imposed in the homes of those who once enforced it. There have been no riots in the state in the last 6.5-7 years,” he said. Highlighting the measures taken by his government to address unemployment, the CM said that six lakh people secured government jobs in the last six years and over 1.75 crore found employment in private sector.“Past governments supported troublemakers, but now police have reined in mischievous elements,” he further said.We also published the following articles recently
summary:
Six lakh got govt jobs in past 6 years: CMAyodhya Ram temple design is disabled-friendlyBJP's Divyang cell state unit president Om Prakash claimed that the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya will be a "Divyang-friendly temple".
Provisions are being made at the under-construction temple to help disabled persons with easy access.
The temple complex will have facilities like lifts and ramps at the entrance to ensure accessibility for Divyangs.
BJP focuses on empowering Divyangs and mobilizing them for the upcoming Lok Sabha polls, recognizing their potential in forming the government.
It is a matter of pride for 140 crore people of the country that the world is now looking up to new India,” the CM said.

title: Ram Temple fervor sparks epic business boom
text:
Items like Ram Darbar & swings in high demand

INDORE: The enthusiasm and fervour for the January 22 consecration of Ram Lalla idol at Ram Mandir in Ayodhya has given a fillip to local businesses and created employment opportunities for gig workers as demand for puja items, flags, lights, idols, decor products, saffron clothes and earthen utensils have almost doubled.Tailors are the hardest to reach these days as they are swamped with orders to stitch flags with Lord Ram or the Ayodhya temple as motifs.Interestingly, saffron-coloured cloth is fast vanishing from the market as the demand for saffron garments, caps and flags peaks.Gig workers engaged in stitching clothes, polishing idols, fixing lights are so busy that they are rejecting orders, forcing organisers to hire people from other cities.Akash Jain, whose family has been selling puja items for four generations from a shop in Marothiya Market, said, "Sales have more than doubled. Demand is huge for all 'pujan samagri', like 'hawan' items, kumkum and betel nuts. We have never seen such a surge in demand and sales in this business in 70 years."Marothiya is one of the oldest markets of Indore and houses 40 pujan samagri shops. The ruling BJP has appealed to people to celebrate the consecration ceremony like Diwali by lighting diyas, decorating temples and organizing programes at markets and homes on January 22. Last week, minister Kailash Vijayvargiya said that more than 1 crore ‘diyas’ would be lit in Indore on the day of the inauguration of Ram Mandir.Idols, brass and copper temple utensils, and related items like Ram Darbar and swings have also seen a sharp jump in demand in a week.Another fourth generation trader, Yugal Jain, of Bartan Bazaar said, “We have called additional staff to cater to customers. The excitement is more than Diwali. We usually see such sales in Diwali but the con- sumer sentiment this time has surpassed all Diwali and wedding season demands.”An organizer of an event proposed at a temple in Rajwada on January 22 said he could not find a vendor to supply him 10,000 flags and jackets in Indore and is now looking for a supplier outside the state.Market associations have announced to decorate shops and light diyas on the day. Some market associ- ations have also organised a series of programmes from January 17.The unprecedented spike in demand has led shopkeepers to maintain high stocks of coconuts, dry fruits, kirana items, décor, lighting and clothes.Arun Vakliwal, member of Maharaja Tukojirao Cloth Market Merchants Association, said, “I sold more than 10,000 flags and clothes in just two days. Demand is in lakhs which is becoming hard to fulfil. We purchase saffron cloth for making flags, caps and jackets from Surat in Gujarat but now they have gone out of stock and this has created a shortage of clothes and flags in the market.”Indore’s Maharani Road market, which houses close to 400 electrical and light shops, has seen a more than 30% jump in demand for fancy and decorative lights, said Rajesh Baheti, president of MP Electrical traders Association.
summary:
Demand is huge for all 'pujan samagri', like 'hawan' items, kumkum and betel nuts.
We have never seen such a surge in demand and sales in this business in 70 years.
"Marothiya is one of the oldest markets of Indore and houses 40 pujan samagri shops.
The ruling BJP has appealed to people to celebrate the consecration ceremony like Diwali by lighting diyas, decorating temples and organizing programes at markets and homes on January 22.
Demand is in lakhs which is becoming hard to fulfil.

title: Bengaluru-Ayodhya airfares rise by nearly 400% to Rs 30,000
text:
Hotel industry gets ready

BENGALURU: With flights from Bengaluru to Ayodhya packed around the day of consecration on January 22, a flood of visitors from the IT hub is expected to throng the areas adjoining the Ram Janmabhoomi Temple site on the weekend preceding the opening of the temple. For a one-way flight from Bengaluru to Ayodhya on January 20, the cheapest ticket is priced at Rs 24,000.Most flights around that weekend are almost sold out, with only a handful of seats available at the time of going to press.For January 20, the priciest ticket is going for Rs 29,700 - marking a 395% increase - for a flight departing Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru at 1 pm and reaching Ayodhya at 11 pm, after a five-hour layover in Ahmedabad.Though the consecration will be an invite-only ceremony, common people have made plans for their Ayodhya trip to savour the experience -- albeit from a distance.According to multiple ticketing agencies, Bengaluru-Ayodhya air tickets are the costliest on Saturday, January 20, followed by Friday, January 19, and Sunday, January 21. For January 19, the air tickets start from Rs 21,500. For January 21, the fares start from Rs 10,000.One-way flight tickets to Ayodhya's Maharishi Valmiki International Airport were priced around Rs 6,000 since the airport began operations this month. Air tickets for even a month after the opening of the temple are priced around Rs 6,000. However, ticket prices for the weekend starting January 19-21 are seeing a massive uptick by the hour as the date for the grand opening nears.While there are currently no direct flights between Bengaluru and Ayodhya, Air India Express will operate thrice-weekly direct flights starting January 17 - on every Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. Most travellers will need to spend at least six-eight hours on the way to reach Ayodhya, with at least one stop-over in either New Delhi, or Gwalior, or Mumbai, or Ahmedabad.Indigo and Air India Express are the only airlines providing connectivity to Ayodhya from Bengaluru. Ankur Garg, chief commercial officer, Air India Express, said, "As pivotal hubs in our network, Bengaluru will serve as a gateway to Ayodhya, providing pilgrims from South India with convenient one-stop itineraries."Leading up to the temple inauguration, Ayodhya is also seeing a boom in construction of hotels and hospitality facilities. Nishant Pitti, CEO of EaseMyTrip, told TOI that hotels are fully booked, enabling them to leverage increased pricing. "Occupancy rates have risen from 80% to 100%, resulting in substantial price hikes, reaching up to Rs 70,000 per night in select hotels," Pitti said."Ayodhya is undergoing significant infrastructural growth, planning for 73 new properties, including 40 that are currently under construction," he added.
summary:
For January 19, the air tickets start from Rs 21,500.
For January 21, the fares start from Rs 10,000.One-way flight tickets to Ayodhya's Maharishi Valmiki International Airport were priced around Rs 6,000 since the airport began operations this month.
Air tickets for even a month after the opening of the temple are priced around Rs 6,000.
"Leading up to the temple inauguration, Ayodhya is also seeing a boom in construction of hotels and hospitality facilities.
"Ayodhya is undergoing significant infrastructural growth, planning for 73 new properties, including 40 that are currently under construction," he added.

title: Nashik youth festival: PM Modi urges youth to engage in active politics
text: NASHIK : Prime Minister Narendra Modi has called upon the youth to come forward and participate in the country’s active politics to reduce the impact of ‘politics of Parivarvad’ (dynastic politics).Addressing the youth delegates during the inauguration of the 27th National Youth Festival in Nashik city on Friday, Modi stressed the need for the youth to actively take part in the democratic process of the country.“India is the mother of the world’s democracy and the country’s youth must be a part of it. There are many ways that the youth can take part in democratic process. One such way is to take part in active politics. And when youth participate in active politics, it will diminish the influence of Parivarwad politics (dynastic politics) in our country,” said PM.According to him, dynastic politics in India have done immense harm to the country. Modi said that the other way to be active in the country’s democratic process. And that is to exercise once franchise in the country’s elections.“There are many of the youth who will be casting their votes for the first time in the forthcoming elections in the country. Such youth must complete the enrolment of their names in the voters list so that they can vote for the better future of the country.He reminded the youth that the next 25 years is not only Amrit Kaal for them but is also a time for Kartavya Kaal for them. “It is imperative for the youth to give top priority to their duties and responsibilities for the development of the society and the nation,” he said.Earlier after arriving in Nashik city, Modi accompanied by the state CM, Eknath Shinde and the two DCMs, Devendra Fadnavis, took part in a road show. Later Modi reformed religious rituals at Goda Ghat—the banks of river Godavari in Nashik city where Lord Ram, Sita and Lakshman had spent few years of their 14 years of exile. He also performed puja at Shree Kalaram Mandir, which is near Goda Ghat.
summary:
There are many ways that the youth can take part in democratic process.
One such way is to take part in active politics.
And when youth participate in active politics, it will diminish the influence of Parivarwad politics (dynastic politics) in our country,” said PM.According to him, dynastic politics in India have done immense harm to the country.
Modi said that the other way to be active in the country’s democratic process.
Later Modi reformed religious rituals at Goda Ghat—the banks of river Godavari in Nashik city where Lord Ram, Sita and Lakshman had spent few years of their 14 years of exile.

title: India successfully conducts flight-test of new-generation AKASH missile
text: BALASORE: India conducted a successful flight test of the new generation AKASH missile on Friday, according to officials. The test took place at the Integrated Test Range (ITR) in Chandipur , Odisha. The missile was tested against a high-speed unmanned aerial target flying at a very low altitude. The weapon system successfully intercepted and destroyed the target.The test validated the functioning of the entire weapon system, which includes the missile with an indigenously developed Radio Frequency Seeker, Launcher, Multi-Function Radar, and Command, Control & Communication system, the officials said.The performance of the system was also validated through data captured by various radars, telemetry, and electro-optical tracking systems deployed by ITR, Chandipur.Senior officials from DRDO, Indian Air Force (IAF), Bharat Dynamics Limited (BDL), and Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) witnessed the flight test.The AKASH-NG system is a state-of-the-art missile system capable of intercepting high-speed, agile aerial threats. The successful flight test has paved the way for user trials.Defence Minister Rajnath Singh commended the DRDO, IAF, PSUs, and the industry for the successful flight test. He stated that the development of this system will further enhance the country's air defence capabilities.Dr. Samir V Kamat, Secretary of the Department of Defence R&D and Chairman DRDO, also congratulated the teams involved in the successful flight test of AKASH-NG.
summary:
BALASORE: India conducted a successful flight test of the new generation AKASH missile on Friday, according to officials.
The test took place at the Integrated Test Range (ITR) in Chandipur , Odisha.
The missile was tested against a high-speed unmanned aerial target flying at a very low altitude.
The successful flight test has paved the way for user trials.Defence Minister Rajnath Singh commended the DRDO, IAF, PSUs, and the industry for the successful flight test.
Samir V Kamat, Secretary of the Department of Defence R&D and Chairman DRDO, also congratulated the teams involved in the successful flight test of AKASH-NG.

title: 'Pran Pratishtha at Ram temple is event of entire society, not the party': Former BJP MP takes swipe at Congress
text: AYODHYA: Asserting that the Pran-Pratishtha ceremony at Ram temple in Ayodhya is an event of the entire society, former MP of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) Ram Vilas Das Vedanti has hit out at the Congress after its veteran Digvijay Singh dubbed the ceremony scheduled to be held later this month as 'BJP/RSS event'.Speaking to ANI, the former BJP MP said that Congress has boycotted 'Hindutva, Sanatan Dharma and nationalism' after declining the invitation to attend the pran-pratishtha at Ram Temple."This is not an event of any party but of the entire society. Nobody has been stopped, and invitations have been extended to every party. This is a religious, devotional, cultural and historical event...Congress has boycotted Hindutva, Sanatan Dharma and nationalism," Vedanti said.He further came down heavily on Congress and said, "People have identified Congress correctly that they are anti-religion, anti-Hindu and anti-Sanatana. People should not support such Congress, the party has proven it by itself..."Earlier on Thursday, Digvijay Singh said that the ceremony at the Ayodhya's temple has been created like an event of the BJP and RSS."Who is going there? Not only the Congress, but Shiv Sena, RJD, CPI (M), JDU, TMC which have got the invitation, are not going there. We will be happy to go to the temple, but let the temple's construction be completed. They have made it an event of the BJP and RSS," Singh said.Referring to VHP leader Champat Rai, who was made the head of the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teertha Kshetra Trust, the Congress leader said, "Champat Rai is the promoter of VHP who has done a land scam. Why is the PM silent on this? Who is Champat Rai to say, 'If Shankaracharyas do not want to come, then let them not to'. Does this temple belong to you? This is the national temple and whoever is interested can come to visit."He also said that the event is a crooked attempt to benefit by making this an election issue.Congress MP Digvijaya Singh also questioned why Nirmohi Akhada's rights have been taken away."Forget the invitation. What we are objecting to is that the construction (of Ram Temple) is not complete. When the construction is not complete, what is the 'pranpratishtha' about? This is against the holy scriptures and religion...This is a crooked attempt to benefit by making this an election issue..." he added."
summary:
"This is not an event of any party but of the entire society.
People should not support such Congress, the party has proven it by itself..."Earlier on Thursday, Digvijay Singh said that the ceremony at the Ayodhya's temple has been created like an event of the BJP and RSS.
Not only the Congress, but Shiv Sena, RJD, CPI (M), JDU, TMC which have got the invitation, are not going there.
What we are objecting to is that the construction (of Ram Temple) is not complete.
This is against the holy scriptures and religion...This is a crooked attempt to benefit by making this an election issue..." he added."

title: Mount abu transforms into winter wonderland as freezing temperatures continue
text: NEW DELHI: Mount Abu , a hill station in Rajasthan, has transformed into a winter wonderland as freezing temperatures persist, blanketing the town in a layer of ice. The mercury dropped to -1 degree Celsius on Friday, following a chilling low of -3 degrees Celsius on Thursday. The entire town, including fields, vehicles, and hotel gardens, is covered in a pristine white layer of ice.The severe cold has disrupted daily life, with residents delaying their routines until late morning.This sudden onset of piercing cold has presented numerous challenges for the people. The minimum temperature consistently hovers below freezing, and residents are resorting to room heaters and other heating methods to combat the winter chill.Weather scientists predict the possibility of another western disturbance that could lead to fluctuations in temperatures, bringing back intense cold conditions. In Sikar district, the mercury plunged below freezing at -0.5 degrees Celsius, forcing residents to gather around bonfires and bundle up in warm layers. Meteorologists warn of even harsher conditions in the coming days. In addition, dense fog conditions continue to prevail in Delhi, leading to low visibility and delays in 39 passenger trains to the national capital.Visibility at Delhi (Palam) Airport was reported to be zero, while Safdarjung Airport reported 200m visibility in dense fog conditions. Several parts of Uttar Pradesh, West Madhya Pradesh, Gwalior, Malda, Gangetic West Bengal, Assam, Punjab, and Ganganagar in Rajasthan also experienced visibility below 500m, according to IMD data.
summary:
NEW DELHI: Mount Abu , a hill station in Rajasthan, has transformed into a winter wonderland as freezing temperatures persist, blanketing the town in a layer of ice.
The mercury dropped to -1 degree Celsius on Friday, following a chilling low of -3 degrees Celsius on Thursday.
The minimum temperature consistently hovers below freezing, and residents are resorting to room heaters and other heating methods to combat the winter chill.Weather scientists predict the possibility of another western disturbance that could lead to fluctuations in temperatures, bringing back intense cold conditions.
In Sikar district, the mercury plunged below freezing at -0.5 degrees Celsius, forcing residents to gather around bonfires and bundle up in warm layers.
Several parts of Uttar Pradesh, West Madhya Pradesh, Gwalior, Malda, Gangetic West Bengal, Assam, Punjab, and Ganganagar in Rajasthan also experienced visibility below 500m, according to IMD data.

title: US, UK conduct precision strikes on Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen
text:
Jan 12, 2024, 08:35AM IST

Source: TOI.in

US President Joe Biden announced strikes in Yemen against Iran-backed Houthi rebels. President biden said that it demonstrates the US and its allies' intolerance for Houthi attacks on the Red Sea. He said tht strikes were carried out after diplomatic negotiations and careful consideration. Biden underscored the response to Houthi attacks on international maritime vessels.“These strikes are in direct response to unprecedented Houthi attacks against international maritime vessels in the Red Sea — including the use of anti-ship ballistic missiles for the first time in history,” Biden said in a statement. On the other hand, Four Royal Air Force typhoons have conducted precision strikes on two Houthi military targets alongside US forces, UK Secretary of State for Defence Rt Hon Grant Shapps said.

text:
Jan 11, 2024, 08:38AM IST

Source: TOI.in

A man was arrested after barging into a Shiva temple in Wembley. He refused to remove his boots and tried to throw a sacred murti and smash a diya. The black male intruder entered the Eelapatheeswarar Alayam Temple on Union Road, which is next door to a mosque. He was dressed in a hoodie with a face mask covering and carrying a book. Temple staff stopped the man and asked him to remove his boots and pull his hoodie down. "He smashed one of the Navagraha structures and tried to shake one of the Navagrahas," a temple staff said.

title: HPV and cervical cancer: Here’s how to lower the risk
text: There are five main types of cancer that affect a woman's reproductive organs i.e., cervical, ovarian, uterine, vaginal, and vulvar. The cervix is the lower, narrow end of the uterus. When cancer starts in the cervix; it is called cervical cancer. Cervical cancer is caused by a virus called as Human Papilloma virus (HPV). All women who are infected with HPV are at risk for cervical cancer.
summary:
There are five main types of cancer that affect a woman's reproductive organs i.e., cervical, ovarian, uterine, vaginal, and vulvar.
The cervix is the lower, narrow end of the uterus.
When cancer starts in the cervix; it is called cervical cancer.
Cervical cancer is caused by a virus called as Human Papilloma virus (HPV).
All women who are infected with HPV are at risk for cervical cancer.

title: ​5 kinds of shawls you must have in your closet
text:
Sushmita Sen gets clicked with her rumoured boyfriend Rohman Shawl; netizens say 'Kitne bf banaogi'

Shawls have been a timeless accessory, offering both warmth and style to various outfits. Whether draped casually over the shoulders or elegantly wrapped around the neck, the versatility of shawl s makes them a must-have in every closet. Here are five types of shawls that can effortlessly elevate your wardrobe with sophistication and flair.1. Classic pashmina shawlThe epitome of elegance, a classic pashmina shawl is a wardrobe essential.Originating from the Persian word for wool, "pashmina" refers to the fine cashmere wool from which these shawls are crafted. Known for their softness, warmth, and luxurious feel, a neutral-colored pashmina shawl complements any outfit, be it a casual daytime look or an evening ensemble. The versatility of the classic pashmina makes it a timeless investment that transcends seasons and trends.2. Cozy woolen shawlEmbrace the winter chill with a cozy woolen shawl. Woolen shawls, often adorned with intricate patterns and designs, add a touch of texture and warmth to your attire. These shawls come in various thicknesses, making them suitable for different climates. Opt for earthy tones or vibrant patterns to add a pop of color to your winter wardrobe. Whether paired with jeans and a sweater or draped over a formal coat, a woolen shawl effortlessly combines comfort and style.3. Embroidered silk shawlElevate your evening attire with the luxurious touch of an embroidered silk shawl. Perfect for special occasions or formal events, these shawls often feature intricate embroidery, beadwork, or sequins that add a hint of glamour. The lightweight nature of silk ensures that it drapes gracefully, making it an ideal accessory to enhance your evening gown or cocktail dress. Choose a silk shawl with subtle embroidery for a timeless look or go bold with vibrant colors and intricate patterns.4. Bohemian fringed shawlChannel your inner free spirit with a bohemian fringed shawl. Characterized by their relaxed and carefree vibe, fringed shawls often feature patterns inspired by tribal or ethnic designs. The fringes add movement and playfulness, making these shawls a stylish addition to casual outfits. Whether paired with denim and a tee or layered over a maxi dress, a bohemian fringed shawl effortlessly infuses a touch of boho-chic into your look.5. Statement velvet shawlFor a touch of opulence and regality, consider adding a statement velvet shawl to your collection. Velvet exudes a rich and luxurious feel, making it a perfect choice for formal occasions or festive gatherings. Opt for deep jewel tones like burgundy, emerald, or royal blue to enhance the plush texture of the fabric. A velvet shawl draped over a classic gown or paired with a tailored suit can instantly elevate your ensemble, making a bold and sophisticated statement.The versatility of shawls transcends seasons and occasions, making them a timeless accessory for any wardrobe. Whether you prefer the understated elegance of a classic pashmina or the bohemian flair of a fringed shawl, investing in a variety of shawls allows you to effortlessly elevate your style with warmth and sophistication. Embrace the art of draping, experiment with different textures and patterns, and let your shawls become the go-to accessory that completes your every look.
summary:
Classic pashmina shawlThe epitome of elegance, a classic pashmina shawl is a wardrobe essential.Originating from the Persian word for wool, "pashmina" refers to the fine cashmere wool from which these shawls are crafted.
Woolen shawls, often adorned with intricate patterns and designs, add a touch of texture and warmth to your attire.
Whether paired with jeans and a sweater or draped over a formal coat, a woolen shawl effortlessly combines comfort and style.3.
Characterized by their relaxed and carefree vibe, fringed shawls often feature patterns inspired by tribal or ethnic designs.
Statement velvet shawlFor a touch of opulence and regality, consider adding a statement velvet shawl to your collection.

title: Why it is important to have pet festivals
text:
Pet Fed is like a

carnival for pets

and pet lovers, with many activities and workshops.

What inspired you to create this event for our furry friends and their owners?

Why do you think there is a need for more festivals like this?



How do you think the festival contributes to strengthening the bond between pets and the owners?



Tell us about some pets that remain etched in your memory?



What are the challenges that you initially faced while organising the festival?



What's your personal favorite activity or workshop that you believe every pet parent should experience at least once?

The connection we share with our pets is a special and cherished relationship that brings joy, companionship, and a unique form of love into our lives. It goes beyond a mere companionship; it's a bond that enriches our daily experiences. Akshay Gupta, Founder of Pet Fed, talks in detail about why it is important to have pet festivals and how celebrating your furry friends can go a long way in changing the way we look at them.I started Pet Fed back in 2014 when I realized that there is an event for every liking of a human being in the country whether it is food, fashion, art, music but there was not anything for people who had pets and pets themselves. For every other thing there is a community of people that you can engage, interact and learn with but there was not anything from pet parents so we thought that we will create something of that sort. Pets and pet parents can come together at a common platform and learn from each other and see what is there in the category for better pet parenting.I think we need to have and encourage more festivals like this so that we can promote pet welfare, strengthen the bond between pets and their owners, and build a sense of community among pet enthusiasts. Main focus is to highlight the importance of Adopting the Pet instead of buying and selling them. We always follow our motto #AdoptDontShop and we want our audience to follow this motto. As you know, selling and buying is not good and appropriate, but adoption allows us to freely choose the pet we want without comparing and buying. It provides shelter for the needy. Pet welfare includes the well-being, health, and humane treatment of animals kept as pets. Ensuring good pet welfare involves meeting their physical, behavioral, and emotional needs.The bond between pet and the owners has to be understanding which requires attention and patience to deal with.Organizing events like this can contribute to raising awareness about responsible pet ownership, providing a space for pet-related businesses to showcase their products and services, and fostering a positive environment for pets and their owners to socialize. Pet festivals like Pet Fed play a crucial role in fortifying the bond between pets and their owners. By offering a plethora of shared experiences, from engaging in various activities to participating in workshops, these events create everlasting memories that deepen the emotional connection.The socialization opportunities provided in festival settings help pets become more accustomed to diverse environments and foster positive behavior in social settings. Fun and play activities, alongside pet-friendly services, contribute to the enjoyment and well-being of pets, reinforcing positive associations with the festival experience. Additionally, participating in training sessions and bonding activities encourages effective communication and teamwork between pets and their owners. The sense of community fostered by pet festivals, where owners share stories and tips, further strengthens the support network and a feeling of belonging. Through talent showcases and celebrations dedicated to the unique bond, these festivals become a joyous ode to the special relationship between pets and their devoted owners.Every Pet Fed festival always has some special memory in our hearts but what always stands out for us is not just dogs and cats. Each year we get to witness a wide variety of pets we never thought and imagined in our lives! From iguanas, hamsters, snakes, to chameleons you name it. Every species shares a special bond with their pet parent.Organizing Pet Fed involves lots of research and experiences and it takes such a toll in our lives because everything is at stake! Initially we faced several challenges like the intricate details of logistics and planning to the complexities of budgeting and securing sponsorships. Marketing and promoting the event, ensuring participant engagement, proactive volunteers, leads and coordinators. Outdoor festivals are susceptible to weather conditions, which can impact attendance and logistics.Contingency plans for unexpected situations are vital.Compliance with regulations, vendor and sponsor management, and prioritizing security and safety add further layers of complexity. Safety and Security is a major concern of our team, where it is essential to be particular and considerate about pets, their owners, participants and team. Feedback collection and progress with every improvement are critical aspects of successful event organization. All it requires and demands meticulous planning, effective communication, and a team capable of addressing a diverse range of issues to deliver a memorable and seamless experience for participants.With in-numerous activities at Pet Fed, there's something for everyone.A masterclass at Pet Fed can be a highly enriching experience for pet parents, offering in-depth insights and expert guidance on various aspects of pet care. These sessions often delve into advanced training techniques, behavior management, and health and wellness practices. Renowned trainers, veterinarians, or specialists may conduct these masterclasses, providing a platform for attendees to deepen their understanding of their pets' needs and behaviors. Whether it's an advanced training masterclass, a deep dive into pet nutrition, or an exploration of holistic well-being, these sessions empower pet parents with practical knowledge and skills. Masterclasses at Pet Fed offer a unique opportunity for attendees to learn from leading experts in the field, enhancing their ability to provide the best possible care for their furry companions.
summary:
Pet Fed is like acarnival for petsand pet lovers, with many activities and workshops.
Pet festivals like Pet Fed play a crucial role in fortifying the bond between pets and their owners.
The sense of community fostered by pet festivals, where owners share stories and tips, further strengthens the support network and a feeling of belonging.
Every species shares a special bond with their pet parent.Organizing Pet Fed involves lots of research and experiences and it takes such a toll in our lives because everything is at stake!
Whether it's an advanced training masterclass, a deep dive into pet nutrition, or an exploration of holistic well-being, these sessions empower pet parents with practical knowledge and skills.

title: How to check the purity and quality of Almonds at home
text: Almonds generally have a sweet taste and crunchy texture. In case there is bitterness in the taste, then it is best to discard the almonds as it indicates the presence of certain chemicals like phytic acid, which is a natural toxin in the outer layer of almonds High-quality almonds have a fresh and nutty aroma. If the almonds smell musty or rancid, it could indicate spoilage.
summary:
Almonds generally have a sweet taste and crunchy texture.
In case there is bitterness in the taste, then it is best to discard the almonds as it indicates the presence of certain chemicals like phytic acid, which is a natural toxin in the outer layer of almonds High-quality almonds have a fresh and nutty aroma.
If the almonds smell musty or rancid, it could indicate spoilage.

title: 'MS Dhoni has given me two-three...': Shivam Dube explains the secret behind his transformation
text:
Wisden picks 2023 men’s ODI team of the year, includes 7 Indians in the XI

NEW DELHI: Marking a dynamic comeback to the Indian team, Shivam Dube played a pivotal role with a powerful 60 not out off 40 balls in the first T20I against Afghanistan. He attributed the positive shift in his attitude and approach to the iconic MS Dhoni , whose influence has been instrumental in Dube's cricketing journey.Dube's impactful half-century significantly contributed to India's comfortable six-wicket victory on Thursday, earning him the well-deserved Player of the Match award."When I came to bat, I wanted to implement what I have learnt from MS Dhoni about finishing games. I keep speaking to Mahi bhai. He tells me about how to tackle different situations. He has given me two-three tips and rated my batting."So, I feel if he rates my batting then I'll keep playing well. My confidence went up because of that," Dube told 'JIO Cinema'.Dube's previous appearance for India was in last year's Asian Games at Hangzhou.The Mumbai player was part of the India squad for home T20I series against Australia but did not get a chance to play and was not selected for the away series against South Africa.Dube also found shades of Dhoni in the wayRohit Sharma captained the side, and allowed him the space to perform."Both allow me to bat higher in the order. There's a lot of work to be done and I know they will back me and want me to do well. So, that makes me feel a lot more positive," he added.Dube also grabbed the important wicket of Afghan captain Ibrahim Zadran (25 off 22 balls), and the pacer said he has been working on his bowling."The changes have not come suddenly. In the off-season, I worked a lot on my fitness. After that, I bowled a lot in domestic cricket too so things kept improving."I was able to find the right areas and also generate a decent pace," he said.
summary:
"When I came to bat, I wanted to implement what I have learnt from MS Dhoni about finishing games.
He has given me two-three tips and rated my batting.
There's a lot of work to be done and I know they will back me and want me to do well.
After that, I bowled a lot in domestic cricket too so things kept improving.
"I was able to find the right areas and also generate a decent pace," he said.

title: Rohit Sharma: 'You feel frustrated...': Rohit Sharma explains his on-field anger after run-out
text:
'These things happen…'

India's final

T20 World Cup

preparations

Rohit mentioned that the team management is deliberately putting players in uncomfortable situations to prepare for the upcoming T20 World Cup in June.

This three-match series against Afghanistan serves as India's final preparation before the tournament, which will be hosted by the United States and the West Indies.

'We want to challenge ourselves'

Comfortable win for India

President Droupadi Murmu confers Arjuna Award to pace bowler Mohammed Shami

NEW DELHI: India emerged victorious in the series opener against Afghanistan with a six-wicket win on a chilly night in Mohali on Thursday.The match marked the comeback of skipper Rohit Sharma to the shortest format after a gap of 14 months. However, Rohit's return did not go as planned, as he was run out due to a mix-up with his opening partner Shubman Gill .In a rare sight, Rohit, who was out for a two-ball duck, expressed his frustration on the field and vented out his anger. Despite the setback, India managed to secure a win, which according to Rohit, was the most important thing."These things happen (on the run-out). When it happens you feel frustrated, you want to be out there and score runs for the team. Everything will not go your way. We won the game, that's more important. I wanted Gill to carry on, but unfortunately got out after playing a very good little innings," Rohit said at the post-match interaction."We want to keep trying different things - try and bowl our bowlers in different situations of the game, like you saw today, Washi ( Washington Sundar ) bowled the 19th over. We want to challenge ourselves in the areas we are slightly uncomfortable with and the bowlers are not used to that," Rohit said."We want to try and do that. Keeping all of those things in mind, we'll try and do whatever is possible but not at the cost of the game. We want to make sure that we come out on top and play the game well. All in all, today was a good day for us," Rohit added.India gunned down the 159-run target in 17.3 overs. Shivam Dube starred with an unbeaten 60 off 40 balls and also took a wicket with his medium pace."There are a lot of positives. Shivam Dube, the way Jitesh batted, Tilak as well and then Rinku is in good form as well," Rohit concluded.
summary:
Despite the setback, India managed to secure a win, which according to Rohit, was the most important thing.
When it happens you feel frustrated, you want to be out there and score runs for the team.
I wanted Gill to carry on, but unfortunately got out after playing a very good little innings," Rohit said at the post-match interaction.
All in all, today was a good day for us," Rohit added.India gunned down the 159-run target in 17.3 overs.
Shivam Dube, the way Jitesh batted, Tilak as well and then Rinku is in good form as well," Rohit concluded.

title: Sumit Nagal outclasses Alex Molcan to enter Australian Open singles main draw
text:
Australian Open Schedule

Where to watch Australian Open

MELBOURNE: India's Sumit Nagal secured a spot in the singles main draw of the Australian Open by registering a comfortable victory over Slovakia's Alex Molcan in the final round of the qualifying tournament.Nagal confidently sailed past Molcan with a scoreline of 6-4, 6-4, wrapping up the match in two hours and three minutes. The crucial breakthrough came when his opponent double-faulted at 30-40 in the 10th game of the second set.The upcoming challenge for Nagal involves a first-round encounter with Kazakhstan's World No.31, Alexander Bublik.Ranked at World No. 139 in singles, this marks Nagal's second appearance in the main draw of the season's opening Grand Slam, following his entry in 2021. Last year, he faced a defeat in the first round against Lithuania's Ricardas Berankis.Nagal has previously earned main draw berths at the US Open in 2019 and 2020. Notably, in 2019, he put up a spirited fight against the legendary Roger Federer, stretching the match to four sets at Flushing Meadows.In 2020, Nagal advanced to the second round of the US Open by defeating Bradley Klahn in the first round with a score of 6-1, 6-3, 3-6, 6-1. However, his journey was halted by the second seed and eventual champion, Dominic Thiem, with a scoreline of 6-3, 6-3, 6-2 in the second round.Sania Mirza, the two-time Australian Open winner, and Somdev Devvarman will be part of the Sony Sports Network’s broadcast."The Australian Open tournament holds a special place in my heart, as I made my Grand Slam debut at the Australian Open in 2005. The Grand Slam continues to be a strong platform for players to showcase their talent, and this year's tournament will feature both emerging talents and established stars lighting up the court," Sania said."I am looking forward to being a part of Extraaa Serve on Sony Sports Network as a panelist throughout the tournament. Throughout the broadcast, we will bring fans closer to all the live action in Australia and also present behind-the-scenes moments of this sporting spectacle," she said.The tournament, scheduled from Sunday, January 14, 2024, to Sunday, January 28, 2024, will captivate fans as Melbourne Park hosts the world's tennis elite in a battle for the coveted first grand slam title of the year.You can watch the Australian Open 2024 on Sony Sports Network

139 in singles, this marks Nagal's second appearance in the main draw of the season's opening Grand Slam, following his entry in 2021.
Last year, he faced a defeat in the first round against Lithuania's Ricardas Berankis.Nagal has previously earned main draw berths at the US Open in 2019 and 2020.
