title: Christmas GK: Was Jesus Christ Really born on 25th December?
text:
December: Not the month birth month of

Celebrations: The Complete Book of American Holidays

The Interpreter's One-Volume Commentary

When was Christ born?

Why was December chosen for Christmas celebration?

Even though Christmas is now known for its shopping frenzy, its original purpose is to commemorate the birth of Jesus, considered by Christians as the son of God. However, historical evidence doesn't support the idea that Jesus was actually born on December 25th, the widely celebrated date of Christmas.The birth of Jesus Christ remains a topic of intrigue and debate, especially concerning the actual month in which it occurred.Various theories emerge when exploring this historical event. One key element in the story revolves around shepherds tending to their flocks, as described in Luke 2:7-8 of the Bible. This detail, so central to the narrative, has been immortalized in Christmas songs. However, sources such asandpoint out that the weather conditions in late December would not have allowed for shepherds to be actively caring for their flocks. This indicates that Jesus might not have been born during the cold days of December but rather during a warmer season.Furthermore, the journey of Mary and Joseph to Bethlehem, prompted by the Roman census, adds another layer to the discussion. Historical analysis suggests that such a census would have more likely occurred during a time when travel was easier and more feasible, indicating that a low turnout, as expected in winter, would have been inconvenient. This aligns with the idea that Jesus was not born in December, as it would have been an improbable time for a mandatory census that required extensive travel. These details challenge the traditional notion that December is the birth month of Jesus Christ, inviting a reconsideration of the timeline surrounding this significant event in history.Determining the birth of Jesus involves tracing John the Baptist's timeline, with his conception believed to be six months before Jesus'. By this calculation, Jesus might have been born in June, as suggested by the United Church of God, pinpointing June 13 to 17 as a possible timeframe for his birth.December became the chosen time for Christmas due to its alignment with existing pagan festivities. Romans celebrated the winter solstice and the pagan festival known as Saturnalia from December 17 to 25. Saturnalia honored Saturn, the god of agriculture, and marked the beginning of a new solar cycle. Alongside this, Mithraism, a worship practice of the Persian god of light, also held significant rituals during this period. When Emperor Constantine I embraced Christianity in 312, church leaders aimed to merge pagan celebrations with Christian beliefs. They linked Jesus' birth to the winter solstice, citing a symbolic connection between the creation of the world and Jesus' conception. This strategic move sought to ease the transition to Christianity for the Roman population. The decision to celebrate Jesus' birth onDecember 25 was, in part, an attempt to bridge the gap between differing beliefs, hoping to encourage the conversion of pagans to Christianity.
summary:
December: Not the month birth month ofCelebrations: The Complete Book of American HolidaysThe Interpreter's One-Volume CommentaryWhen was Christ born?
Even though Christmas is now known for its shopping frenzy, its original purpose is to commemorate the birth of Jesus, considered by Christians as the son of God.
These details challenge the traditional notion that December is the birth month of Jesus Christ, inviting a reconsideration of the timeline surrounding this significant event in history.Determining the birth of Jesus involves tracing John the Baptist's timeline, with his conception believed to be six months before Jesus'.
They linked Jesus' birth to the winter solstice, citing a symbolic connection between the creation of the world and Jesus' conception.
The decision to celebrate Jesus' birth onDecember 25 was, in part, an attempt to bridge the gap between differing beliefs, hoping to encourage the conversion of pagans to Christianity.

title: Indian Railways Facts: 10 surprising facts that every student should know about
text:
The most extensive daily transportation provider

Indian Railways hosts the world’s highest rail bridge

IRCTC portal has heavy traffic

Indian Railways has a station spanning 2 states

Elephants helped build the Indian Railways

Indian Railways: World’s largest employer

Home to the world’s longest platform

Indian Railways has a mascot

Gatimaan Express, the fastest Indian train

Fairy Queen, the oldest functioning steam locomotive

The Indian Railways boasts of a legacy spanning more than 163 years. IRCTC, its online ticketing arm, books 1 million tickets in just a few hours.The railways hold a significant presence, not just in our daily lives, but also in literature and the cinematic world, often playing a vital role in Indian movies. They've seamlessly woven themselves into the fabric of life across India.The vibrant history of Indian Railways harbours fascinating, lesser-known details that can take anyone by surprise. Out of the plethora of intriguing facts, here are just 10 handpicked ones. Let's delve into these facts and see how many you're already familiar with!Indian Railways, renowned as the largest daily traffic carrier, boasts an extensive network connecting the diverse tapestry of India. Operating over 12,817 trains on an average day, this colossal system serves as a lifeline, transporting approximately 24 million passengers across the nation. Beyond its sheer scale, the railways weave through varied landscapes, from bustling cities to serene countryside, offering a glimpse into India's rich cultural mosaic. Despite challenges, it remains a testament to engineering prowess, cultural integration, and logistical excellence, perpetuating its legacy as not just a transportation system but a symbol of unity traversing the vibrant heart of the country.The Indian Railway's bridge over River Chenab in Jammu and Kashmir stands as an engineering marvel. Spanning the picturesque Chenab Gorge, it's the world's highest rail bridge, towering at around 359 meters above the riverbed. This stunning architectural feat, part of the Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Rail Link Project, symbolizes India's engineering prowessThe IRCTC portal experiences substantial traffic due to its popularity among millions of users booking train tickets daily. Estimates suggest that around 12 lakh people access it per minute. The heavy influx often leads to temporary slowdowns or occasional server issues, especially during peak hours.Indian Railways proudly hosts the Navapur railway station, a unique junction straddling the border between Maharashtra and Gujarat. This exceptional station platform allows passengers to step across state lines simply by moving from one end to the other. Even the signboard is divided.During the inception of the Indian Railways, elephants played a pivotal role in its construction. These majestic creatures showcased their incredible strength and dexterity, aiding in the clearance of dense forests and hauling heavy machinery across challenging terrains where conventional methods faltered. Their remarkable capability to navigate through rugged landscapes proved indispensable in laying down tracks and transporting colossal materials.Indian Railways stands as a colossal employment provider globally, boasting a workforce of over 1.3 million individuals. This mammoth workforce not only drives the day-to-day operations but also embodies the diverse talent contributing to the railway's multifaceted functionalities. From engineers, station masters, and technicians to administrative staff and maintenance crews, the railway system serves as a robust job creator across various skill sets. Its significant employment capacity has not only contributed to the livelihoods of millions but also underscores the railway's pivotal role in sustaining livelihoods, fostering economic stability, and embodying an essential pillar of India's employment landscape on a global scale.Indian Railways proudly hosts the world's longest railway platform at Gorakhpur Junction in Uttar Pradesh, stretching approximately 1,366 meters. This expansive platform can accommodate multiple trains simultaneously, showcasing the railway's efficiency in managing high traffic volumes. Serving as a bustling hub, it facilitates seamless passenger transfers and train operations. Its colossal length ensures convenience for travelers, allowing ample space for boarding and alighting.Indian Railways introduced Bholu, an endearing white elephant, as its official mascot in 2002. This jovial giant creature, dressed as a railway guard, came to the picture on the 150th year of the Indian Railways. Inspired by the significant role elephants played in the railway's history during construction, Bholu symbolizes strength, reliability, and the enduring bond between the railways and the nation.The Gatimaan Express holds the prestigious title of India's fastest train, cruising at speeds of up to 160 km/h. This high-speed marvel connects Delhi to Agra, home of the iconic Taj Mahal, in a swift journey that marries comfort and efficiency. Equipped with state-of-the-art amenities and luxurious interiors, the Gatimaan Express epitomizes modern rail travel.The Fairy Queen, a timeless gem in the history of Indian Railway, reigns as the oldest working steam locomotive globally. Recognized by the Guinness World Records, this majestic engine charms passengers on special heritage runs between Delhi and Alwar. With origins dating back to 1855, its ornate design and vintage allure evoke a bygone era. The Fairy Queen stands as a cherished relic, preserving the essence of steam-powered locomotion and captivating enthusiasts with its nostalgic journey through time.
summary:
The most extensive daily transportation providerIndian Railways hosts the world’s highest rail bridgeIRCTC portal has heavy trafficIndian Railways has a station spanning 2 statesElephants helped build the Indian RailwaysIndian Railways: World’s largest employerHome to the world’s longest platformIndian Railways has a mascotGatimaan Express, the fastest Indian trainFairy Queen, the oldest functioning steam locomotiveThe Indian Railways boasts of a legacy spanning more than 163 years.
They've seamlessly woven themselves into the fabric of life across India.The vibrant history of Indian Railways harbours fascinating, lesser-known details that can take anyone by surprise.
Spanning the picturesque Chenab Gorge, it's the world's highest rail bridge, towering at around 359 meters above the riverbed.
Even the signboard is divided.During the inception of the Indian Railways, elephants played a pivotal role in its construction.
This jovial giant creature, dressed as a railway guard, came to the picture on the 150th year of the Indian Railways.

title: 5 lesser-known tidbits about Napoleon's hat
text:
Two-Pointed Design

Exaggerated Angle

Made by Poupard

Various Materials

Worn Tilted

In a recent auction held in Paris, a bicorne hat, famously worn by Napoleon Bonaparte during his reign as the French emperor, was sold for a staggering €1.932m (£1.69m). This particular hat is among the estimated 20 that have survived out of the 120 believed to have been owned by the renowned French military leader throughout his lifetime.Napoleon had several hats of the same style, known as bicornes.They varied in size and quality, ranging from more practical, everyday wear to ceremonial or specially crafted pieces for significant events. After Napoleon's exile, some of his hats were collected and preserved. Today, a few of them remain in museums and private collections, serving as historical artifacts. These iconic pieces have several interesting stories and facts surrounding them. Here are 5 lesser-known tidbits about Napoleon's hat .: The defining characteristic of the bicorne was its two points, one at the front and one at the back. This style was popular among military officers of the time for its practicality and distinctive appearance. The two points helped deflect rainwater away from the wearer's face and shoulders.: Napoleon's hats often had a more pronounced angle than typical bicornes. This exaggerated angle contributed to its unique and recognizable silhouette. The design also allowed for better visibility on the battlefield.: Napoleon's preferred hatter was a man named Poupard, who crafted several of his hats. Poupard was renowned for his craftsmanship and attention to detail. While specific details about Poupard's life and interactions with Napoleon might not be extensively documented, his work and reputation as a skilled hatter have been mentioned in historical records and accounts related to Napoleon's attire and accessories.: Napoleon's hats were made from various materials, including beaver fur and felt, showcasing the wealth and status of the wearer.: Napoleon often wore his hat tilted to the side, which became a part of his signature style. This distinctive way of wearing it added to his iconic image. Moreover, tilting the hat allowed Napoleon to have a clear line of sight, particularly on the battlefield. It provided better visibility, enabling him to survey the troops and surroundings more effectively. The tilted sign also carried a symbolic meaning. It was seen as a non-verbal communication of authority and confidence, portraying Napoleon's strong and decisive leadership.Napoleon's hat has been a recurring motif in art and culture, symbolizing power, authority, and historical significance. Despite Napoleon's eventual defeat and exile, his hat continues to be an enduring symbol of an era and a man whose influence on history is still studied and remembered today.
summary:
Here are 5 lesser-known tidbits about Napoleon's hat .
: Napoleon's hats often had a more pronounced angle than typical bicornes.
: Napoleon's hats were made from various materials, including beaver fur and felt, showcasing the wealth and status of the wearer.
: Napoleon often wore his hat tilted to the side, which became a part of his signature style.
Moreover, tilting the hat allowed Napoleon to have a clear line of sight, particularly on the battlefield.

title: Mount Olympus: Greece's highest mountain, steeped in legendary tales from ancient mythology
text:
Mount Olympus in Greek mythology

The environmental ecosystem of Mount Olympus

India boasts Mount Kanchenjunga as its highest peak, and each country has its own towering summit. In Greece, that honour belongs to Mount Olympus, rising 2918 meters above sea level. Nestled between Pieria and Larissa provinces, it marks the boundary of Macedonia and Thessaly. But beyond its height and location, Mount Olympus is steeped in Greek mythology .Exploring its ties to ancient legends and how it was shaped unveils captivating tales waiting to be discovered.Created countless eons in the pastWhen observing Mount Olympus closely, you'll notice its unique microclimate. But what exactly is that? A microclimate refers to specific weather conditions different from its surrounding areas. This mountain's peculiar climate is influenced by its proximity to the sea and its elevation. Scientists believe Mount Olympus formed over 200 million years ago when layers of sedimentary rocks from the nearby shallow sea gathered, shaping its structure. Additionally, glacial movements caused geological shifts, resulting in depressions around the mountain. As temperatures rose, glaciers melted, carrying crushed rocks to the sea and leaving behind a colossal alluvial fan. This fan, resembling a cone-shaped heap of sediment, played a significant role in the formation of Mount Olympus. Over time, these natural processes sculpted this majestic peak, offering a glimpse into the intriguing geological history of this legendary mountain.In ancient Greek stories, Mount Olympus was believed to be the dwelling place of gods and goddesses. According to their tales, this mountain's summit held Zeus's throne, where the Olympians, twelve powerful gods and goddesses, resided within hidden palaces nestled amid numerous valleys. They were thought to live much like humans, engaging in activities and ruling from their respective castles atop the peak.This belief led Greek tribes to name the highest points of various areas Olympus, linking them symbolically to the mountain. Thus, peaks in places like Mysia, Laconia, Lycia, Cyprus, Attica, Euboea, Ionia, and Lesbos were all called Olympus. The ancient Greeks also revered Mount Olympus as the origin of Zeus's immense power, which they associated with supernatural forces. Interestingly, people lived only in the foothills because the mountain's higher regions were believed to be the exclusive domain of the gods and goddesses.Mount Olympus boasts diverse landscapes and a rich array of plants and animals. Its terrain supports Mediterranean shrubs and a mix of deciduous and coniferous trees like willows, alders, beeches, black pines, and vibrant red lilies. Among the unique species is the robolo or Olympus pine, creating lush sub-alpine meadows. Various flowers thrive here too, such as daphne, buxus, juniperus, astragalus, and berberis.The region hosts nine to ten woodpecker species, horned larks, alpine accentors, golden eagles, short-toed snake eagles, European honey buzzards, and the rare wallcreeper. Additionally, it's a haven for over 170 butterfly species. This diverse ecosystem in Mount Olympus provides a habitat for a wide range of flora and fauna, making it a fascinating and biodiverse area to explore.
summary:
Mount Olympus in Greek mythologyThe environmental ecosystem of Mount OlympusIndia boasts Mount Kanchenjunga as its highest peak, and each country has its own towering summit.
But beyond its height and location, Mount Olympus is steeped in Greek mythology .Exploring its ties to ancient legends and how it was shaped unveils captivating tales waiting to be discovered.Created countless eons in the pastWhen observing Mount Olympus closely, you'll notice its unique microclimate.
This fan, resembling a cone-shaped heap of sediment, played a significant role in the formation of Mount Olympus.
The ancient Greeks also revered Mount Olympus as the origin of Zeus's immense power, which they associated with supernatural forces.
This diverse ecosystem in Mount Olympus provides a habitat for a wide range of flora and fauna, making it a fascinating and biodiverse area to explore.

What you’ll learn

Chemistry experiments provide an immersive way for Class 10 students to grasp fundamental concepts. They not only demonstrate scientific principles but also encourages critical thinking and hands-on learning. These experiments not only reinforce theoretical concepts but also foster scientific inquiry and analytical skills in Class 10 students. Conducting hands-on experiments encourages a deeper understanding of chemistry while igniting a passion for scientific exploration.Here are 10 captivating experiments, complete with procedures, required materials and scientific explanations.Try them today.Supervision and safety measures are crucial while performing these experiments to ensure a safe and enriching learning experience.Acid/base solutions, burette, pipette, indicator, conical flask.Prepare a standard solution of acid or base and use it to titrate another solution of known concentration. Use an indicator to determine the endpoint of the reaction.You’ll get to know about neutralization reactions, titration techniques, and how to calculate the concentration of an unknown solution using known concentrations.Potassium iodate, sodium thiosulfate, starch solution, beakers.Procedure: Mix solutions of potassium iodate, sodium thiosulfate, and starch. Observe the sudden colour change and measure the time taken for the reaction.This demonstrates the concept of reaction kinetics and how altering concentrations affects reaction rates.Electrolysis apparatus, water, electrodes, power source.Set up an electrolysis apparatus with two electrodes immersed in water, connected to a power source. Observe the gases produced at each electrode.This experiment demonstrates electrolysis, separating water into hydrogen and oxygen gases, showcasing the concepts of electrolytes and redox reactions.Salt/sugar, water, containers, stirring rods.Dissolve a substance like salt or sugar in water and allow it to evaporate slowly, leading to crystal formation.Students explore crystallization processes, crystal structures, and the impact of temperature and concentration on crystal growth with the help of this experiment.Modeling kits, balls, sticks.: Construct 3D models of molecules using materials like colored balls and sticks, depicting how atoms bond to form compounds.This fun experiment illustrates molecular shapes, bonding angles, and how different elements combine to form compounds.pH paper/meter, various household substances.Test the pH levels of household substances using pH paper or a pH meter.: It introduces students to the concepts of acidity and alkalinity, showcasing the pH scale and the impact of different substances on pH levels.Ingredients for cooking or baking.Observe and record chemical changes during cooking, such as caramelization or leavening in baking.: This experiment explores chemical reactions involved in food preparation, like Maillard reactions and fermentation.Various organic substances, reagents for specific tests.Perform tests like the iodine test for starch, Benedict's test for reducing sugars, and the Biuret test for proteins.: It demonstrates identification tests for organic compounds, emphasizing their unique reactions.Natural materials, test reagents.Analyze the chemical composition of natural materials like fruits or vegetables using simple tests.: Students can explore the presence of substances like starch, sugars, or acids in natural products using chemical tests.Iron nails, containers, water.Expose iron nails to moisture to observe the process of rust formation.: Through this experiment, students can grasp the concept of oxidation-reduction reactions very well and how environmental factors impact the rusting process.

title: UGC delists Meghalaya Techno Global University, details here
text:
"Techno Global University shillong, has never started any academic activity since inception. We have never issued any marksheet, certificate and degree to any person. We have also never authorised any person or institution to act on behalf of us."

The University Grants Commission (UGC) has removed the name of Techno Global University , Meghalaya from the list of recognised universities . It is speculated that the the decision of UGC is based on the state education department 's recommendation to remove the university as it does not exist.Techno Global University (TGU) was established as a state private university and included in the UGC's list in January 2013, according to the UGC.The government of Meghalaya had set up the university to provide various courses, spanning physical sciences , life sciences , technology, medical science, management, humanities, and more. These courses were sponsored by Techno India, Kolkata, West Bengal.However, in a turn of events, the government of Meghalaya, through a letter dated 27.09.2022, recommended the removal of TGU from the UGC list, citing its non-existence. The UGC notice explained that TGU, as per its website, had not initiated any academic activities since its inception and had never issued any certificates, degrees, or marksheets. The university also clarified that it had not authorized any person or institution to act on its behalf.Upon checking the official website of the TGU Meghalaya (technoglobaluniversity.com), a statement appears on the page, statingIn response to these developments, the UGC subsequently removed the name of Techno Global University, Shillong, Meghalaya, from its list of recognized universities. The state government, in 2019, had enacted an amendment act, specifying that decisions affecting the university's closure, degree cancellations, admission stoppage, or any matter concerning the State Government's interests would be made by the Visitor after consulting with the State Government.
summary:
"Techno Global University shillong, has never started any academic activity since inception.
We have also never authorised any person or institution to act on behalf of us."
The University Grants Commission (UGC) has removed the name of Techno Global University , Meghalaya from the list of recognised universities .
These courses were sponsored by Techno India, Kolkata, West Bengal.However, in a turn of events, the government of Meghalaya, through a letter dated 27.09.2022, recommended the removal of TGU from the UGC list, citing its non-existence.
The university also clarified that it had not authorized any person or institution to act on its behalf.Upon checking the official website of the TGU Meghalaya (technoglobaluniversity.com), a statement appears on the page, statingIn response to these developments, the UGC subsequently removed the name of Techno Global University, Shillong, Meghalaya, from its list of recognized universities.

title: Pariksha Pe Charcha 2024 registration last date today, 181.16+ lakh students registered till Jan 11
text:
How to apply for PPC 2024?

Direct Link:

NEW DELHI: The Ministry of Education (MoE) will close the registration process for Pariksha Pe Charcha 2024 today, January 12. Interested students who have not yet applied can visit the official website - innovateindia1.mygov.in at the earliest and register now.Pariksha Pe Charcha 2024 is a national-level interactive program organised by the Government of India to help students prepare for the upcoming board examinations and reduce exam stress.The program is a part of the larger movement 'Exam Warriors' led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi , to create a stress-free atmosphere for youngsters.During the event, PM interacts with students, parents, and teachers to answer their questions and provide guidance. The questions can be on any topic related to examinations, such as preparation tips, study techniques, exam stress, and career guidance.The PPC 2024 application window was opened on December 11, 2023, and the registration process will conclude today. As of January 11, 2024, more than 181.16 lakh students, 13.52+ lakh teachers and 4.74+ lakh parents have registered for the Pariksha Pe Charcha 2024 event.The seventh edition of PPC will be held on January 29, 2024, at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi. The competition is open for students studying in Classes 6 to 12; parents, and teachers. Students may also submit their questions to the Prime Minister in a maximum of 500 characters. Parents and teachers can also participate and submit their entries in the online activities designed exclusively for them.Step 1: Visit the official website at innovateindia.mygov.in Step 2: On the homepage, click on Pariksha Pe Charcha 2024 under the Latest Initiative section.Step 3: A new webpage will open, scroll down and click on "Student (Self Participation)" under the Participate As section.Step 4: You will be redirected to another page, log in either with your mobile number or email ID.Step 5: Proceed with filling out the PPC 2024 application form and submit it.Step 6: Download the confirmation page and get its hard copy for further reference.About 2050 students, teachers, and parents selected through competitions on MyGov, will be gifted with PPC Kits by MoE. For more details and further information, students are suggested to keep visiting the official website of MyGov.
summary:
How to apply for PPC 2024?
Direct Link:NEW DELHI: The Ministry of Education (MoE) will close the registration process for Pariksha Pe Charcha 2024 today, January 12.
As of January 11, 2024, more than 181.16 lakh students, 13.52+ lakh teachers and 4.74+ lakh parents have registered for the Pariksha Pe Charcha 2024 event.The seventh edition of PPC will be held on January 29, 2024, at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi.
The competition is open for students studying in Classes 6 to 12; parents, and teachers.
Students may also submit their questions to the Prime Minister in a maximum of 500 characters.

title: ICMAI Announces CMA Foundation December 2023 Results at icmai.in; Check Here
text:

CMA Foundation December 2023 Result:

The Institute of Cost Accountants of India (ICMAI) has officially released the results for the CMA Foundation December 2023 examinations. The examinations for ICMAI held in December 2023 took place on December 17.Candidates can access their results through the official website - https://icmai.in/icmai/ - to check their performance in the CMA Foundation December 2023 Examination.To view their CMA results from the ICMAI December 2023 exams , students need to enter their respective registration numbers . The identification number format for new registrations, implemented after 2012, is specified as follows: (EF0000001234, SF0000000123, NF0000000123), as indicated on the result website statement. Students are advised to use this format to ensure accurate access to their examination results.The foundation examination for December 2023, conducted by the institute, was administered through an offline OMR centre-based format.Following this achievement, the next recommended step is to register for the CMA Intermediate exam , the subsequent stage in the CMA pathway. Interested candidates can register online through the ICMAI website , with the next exam session anticipated in June 2024. Applicants are advised to stay informed about official dates, as applications typically open a few months before the examination period.

title: BPSC Assistant Professor Result Announced: 202 Candidates Selected; Check Direct link here
text:
BPSC

Assistant Professor

Result 2024:

The Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) has declared the final results of the Assistant Professor, Computer Science and Engineering Competitive Examination on its official website. The candidates, who took the examination, can check and download their results online on the official website - https://www.bpsc.bih.nic.in/.The interviews, conducted from November 27 to December 1, 2023, assessed 504 candidates who had cleared the written (objective) examination for 208 Assistant Professor positions in Government Engineering Colleges under the Department of Science and Technology, Bihar (Advertisement No. 07/2022).Out of the 439 candidates who appeared, two female candidates from the Economically Weaker Section failed to present the required certificate during document verification/interview. Consequently, their exam results were cancelled as they did not meet the cut-off marks.The remaining 437 candidates underwent a comprehensive assessment, with their combined merit list based on academic marks and interview performance. In cases of tied total marks, priority was given to candidates with higher marks in the written examination and, if necessary, older candidates by date of birth. A post reserved for a candidate with a pending Ph.D. estimation ensured fair consideration for those awaiting degree completion.Out of the 208 vacancies, 202 candidates were selected based on merit and reservation criteria, including provisions for disabled candidates. Due to the unavailability of five disabled candidates, five unreserved posts and one backward-class post remain vacant.

07/2022).Out of the 439 candidates who appeared, two female candidates from the Economically Weaker Section failed to present the required certificate during document verification/interview.

title: 8 Important Tips to Crack JEE Mains 2024 in First Attempt
text:
Understand the Exam Pattern

Personalised Study Schedule

Focus on Basics and NCERT

Practice Regularly

Revision is Key

Seek Guidance and Clarify Doubts

Stay Healthy

Stay Positive and Manage Stress

Cracking the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Mains in the first attempt is an intimidating task that demands proper planning and dedicated effort. As one of the most competitive engineering entrance examinations in India, JEE Mains requires a strategic approach to ensure success. To navigate this challenging journey effectively in the first attempt, aspirants must adhere to some important tips that encompass understanding the exam pattern, creating a study schedule, focusing on foundational concepts, consistent practice, regular revision, etc.These tips collectively form a holistic strategy aimed at not only enhancing academic proficiency but also fostering mental resilience, ultimately paving the way for a successful performance in JEE Mains 2024 .Here are the 8 important tips to help you prepare effectively to clear the engineering entrance exam in the initial attempt.Familiarize yourself with the JEE Mains exam pattern, including the number of questions, marking scheme, and time duration. Knowing the structure of the exam will help you plan your preparation accordingly.Develop a well-organized study timetable that covers all the subjects. Allocate sufficient time to each topic based on your strengths and weaknesses. Be realistic about the number of hours you can dedicate each day, and include breaks for relaxation.Build a strong foundation by thoroughly understanding the basic concepts from NCERT textbooks. JEE Mains questions are often based on fundamental principles, so a clear understanding of the basics is important.Practice solving a variety of problems regularly. Use previous years' question papers and mock tests to simulate exam conditions. This will not only improve your time management skills but also help you identify and work on your weak areas.Regularly revise the topics you have covered. Create concise notes that you can go through quickly before the exam. Revision is essential to reinforce concepts and ensure better retention.If you encounter difficulties in understanding certain topics, don't hesitate to seek help from teachers, classmates, or online resources. Clarifying doubts promptly will prevent misconceptions from affecting your understanding.A healthy mind resides in a healthy body. Ensure you get enough sleep, eat a balanced diet, and exercise regularly. Physical well-being contributes significantly to your ability to concentrate and stay focused during long study sessions.Maintain a positive attitude throughout your preparation. Don't let stress and anxiety overwhelm you. Practice meditation, deep breathing, or any relaxation techniques to stay calm during the exam.
summary:
Understand the Exam PatternPersonalised Study ScheduleFocus on Basics and NCERTPractice RegularlyRevision is KeySeek Guidance and Clarify DoubtsStay HealthyStay Positive and Manage StressCracking the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Mains in the first attempt is an intimidating task that demands proper planning and dedicated effort.
As one of the most competitive engineering entrance examinations in India, JEE Mains requires a strategic approach to ensure success.
Knowing the structure of the exam will help you plan your preparation accordingly.Develop a well-organized study timetable that covers all the subjects.
JEE Mains questions are often based on fundamental principles, so a clear understanding of the basics is important.Practice solving a variety of problems regularly.
Physical well-being contributes significantly to your ability to concentrate and stay focused during long study sessions.Maintain a positive attitude throughout your preparation.

title: JEE Main 2024 image correction window open till tomorrow; Here's all you need to know
text:
JEE Main 2024:

Specifications for Candidate's Photograph:

JEE Main 2024 Image Correction: Important Dates

Activity

From

To

Uploading of Photograph as per specification

January 4, 2024

January 6, 2024 (upto 11:50 PM)



Important Note

JEE Main 2024 Image Correction:

Step to upload correct photographs

The National Testing Agency (NTA) has identified a discrepancy in the photographs uploaded by some candidates for the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE Main) 2024. To rectify this issue and prevent the rejection of applications, the NTA has initiated an Image Correction Window. This window allows candidates to upload their recent photographs according to the specified guidelines.The correction window is open from January 4, 2024, and candidates have until January 6, 2024 (up to 11:50 PM) to make the necessary changes.Candidates must adhere to the following specifications when uploading their photographs:• The photograph should be passport-sized with a size ranging from 10 kb to 200 kb.• The recent photograph should be either in colour or black & white with 80% of the face (without a mask) visible, including ears, against a white background.• Spectacles are allowed only if regularly used.• Polaroid and computer-generated photos are not acceptable.• Applications not complying with these instructions or containing unclear photographs are subject to rejection.• Applications without photographs will be rejected.• Candidates are not required to get the photographs attested. It is advisable to keep 6 to 8 passport-size colour photographs with a white background.If the uploaded photographs are found to be fabricated, reshaped, or appear to be hand-made or computer-made, the application will be rejected by the Agency and such instances will be considered as using Unfair Means, and candidates will face appropriate consequences.Candidates are strongly advised to take note of these specifications and act accordingly within the given timeframe. Regularly checking the NTA website at https://jeemain.nta.ac.in/ for further updates is recommended.For any queries or clarifications, candidates can contact the NTA Help Desk at 011-40759000/011-6922770 or write to NTA at jeemain@nta.ac.in. The NTA encourages candidates to stay informed and ensure compliance with the specified guidelines to avoid any issues in the application process.Step 1: Visit the official JEE Main website and log in to your candidate account using your credentials.Step 2: Navigate to the "Image Correction" or similar section within your filled-out application form.Step 3: Carefully read the guidelines provided for image specifications, ensuring compliance with passport-sized photo requirements.Step 4: Choose the correct image from your device that adheres to the specified guidelines. Upload this image to replace the existing one.Step 5: After uploading the corrected image, review the changes and ensure accuracy. Submit the corrected image to save the modifications.Step 6: Confirm that the updated image reflects correctly in your application form. Check for any confirmation message provided by the system.Note: It is important to adhere to the specified guidelines for photograph specifications during this correction process to avoid any further discrepancies.

The GATE 2024 results will be announced on March 16, 2024.The Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering is conducted to assess the comprehensive understanding and knowledge of candidates in various engineering and science subjects. The primary purpose of the GATE exam is to evaluate the candidates' proficiency in their respective fields and to determine their eligibility for postgraduate programs, including Master's and Doctoral programs, as well as for employment in public sector undertakings (PSUs). title: JEE Main 2024 Session 1: Preparation strategy for the last 20 days
text:
1. Focus on Revision and Practice:

Revise key concepts

Practice solving problems

READ ALSO:

2. Prioritise your subjects:

Discover what you're good at and where you need improvement

Concentrate on important topics

3. Time Management:

Plan your study routine:

Master time management in practice tests

READ ALSO:

4. Take care of yourself:

Keep a healthy lifestyle

Stay positive and motivated

The National Testing Agency (NTA) is all set to conduct the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Main Session-I Examination 2024 from January 24 to February 01.With only 20 days left for JEE Main 2024 January Session exam, it's crucial to have a well-defined strategy to maximise your score. Here's a plan to help you ace the exam:: Don't try to learn new things at this stage.Instead, focus on revising the important formulas, theorems, and derivations you've already covered. Make flashcards or mind maps to aid quick recall.: Solving problems is the key to understanding and applying concepts. Focus on solving previous years' JEE Main papers and mock tests. Analyse your mistakes and identify areas for improvement. Aim for at least 2-3 mock tests per week.: Review how you did in past practice tests and figure out which subjects or topics require extra attention. Spend extra time on the areas where you struggle, but make sure to maintain a balance by also dedicating time to subjects you excel in.: Get to know the significance of various chapters in the JEE Main syllabus. Give priority to reviewing and practising the topics that are assigned higher marks.Develop a practical study schedule that sets aside enough time for every subject and topic. Incorporate breaks to prevent feeling overwhelmed. Try your best to follow your schedule consistently.: Replicate the real exam setting by attempting mock tests with time constraints. Doing so will enable you to formulate an effective time management strategy for the actual exam.: Ensure you get sufficient sleep, consume nutritious meals, and engage in regular exercise. Taking care of your physical and mental well-being will aid in maintaining focus and energy throughout your preparation.: Have faith in yourself and your skills. Don't be disheartened by obstacles. Keep in mind that diligence and persistence are always rewarded.

Focus on solving previous years' JEE Main papers and mock tests.
Aim for at least 2-3 mock tests per week.

title: JEE Main 2024 Preparation: 5 Tips to Ace Organic Chemistry
text:
Here are 5 tips to

ace Organic Chemistry in JEE

Main 2024

Master the Mechanisms

READ ALSO:

Improve your Problem-Solving Skills

Get Familiar with Reaction Intermediates

Embrace Visual Aids

READ ALSO:

Group Study and Discussions

Students preparing for the Joint Entrance Examination (Mains) often find organic chemistry tricky and challenging. In general, students rate chemistry as the easiest of the three: Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry. However, a large section of the students struggle in this section.: Organic Chemistry focuses on understanding how electrons move and rearrange during reactions.Instead of just memorising reaction equations, explore the mechanisms that drive them. Figure out the electron movements, recognise important intermediates, and grasp the forces guiding each step. This thorough comprehension will help you to handle new challenges and forecast reaction results.: The key to success is practice! Work on solving different problems, including multiple-choice questions and numerical ones, that encompass various reactions and functional groups. Concentrate on problems that require applying your understanding of mechanisms and their application in multi-step synthesis. Take advantage of previous JEE papers and practice tests to become acquainted with the exam structure and pinpoint areas where you excel or need improvement.: In organic reactions, carbocations and carbanions play a crucial role but they are often overlooked. Knowing how they form, their stability, and how they react will provide you with a significant advantage. Develop the skill to identify them in reaction processes and foresee how they influence the final products.: Understanding organic molecules and their changes can be tricky when approached abstractly. Make it easier by using flashcards with clearly labelled structures, drawing reaction arrows on whiteboards, and forming mind maps to link various concepts. Seeing the processes visually will strengthen your comprehension and improve your memory recall.: Engaging in study sessions and talking about concepts with your classmates can be really helpful. Share your study materials, clarify complex mechanisms to one another, and quiz each other's understanding. This teamwork in learning will boost your confidence and expose you to different viewpoints.Keep in mind that Organic Chemistry isn't just about rote memorisation; it's about gaining a profound grasp of the core principles and using them to tackle problems. Summarise essential ideas, emphasise crucial reactions, and create a glossary of important terms. This well-organised study material will serve as your handy reference for swift review and last-minute studying.
summary:
Here are 5 tips toace Organic Chemistry in JEEMain 2024Master the MechanismsREAD ALSO:Improve your Problem-Solving SkillsGet Familiar with Reaction IntermediatesEmbrace Visual AidsREAD ALSO:Group Study and DiscussionsStudents preparing for the Joint Entrance Examination (Mains) often find organic chemistry tricky and challenging.
: Organic Chemistry focuses on understanding how electrons move and rearrange during reactions.Instead of just memorising reaction equations, explore the mechanisms that drive them.
Work on solving different problems, including multiple-choice questions and numerical ones, that encompass various reactions and functional groups.
: In organic reactions, carbocations and carbanions play a crucial role but they are often overlooked.
: Understanding organic molecules and their changes can be tricky when approached abstractly.

Interested candidates can register online through the ICMAI website , with the next exam session anticipated in June 2024. Applicants are advised to stay informed about official dates, as applications typically open a few months before the examination period.

title: Maharashtra Forest Guard Result 2023 released at mahaforest.gov.in, direct link to download
text:
How to check Maharashtra Forest Guard Result 2023?

Direct Link:

Maharashtra Vanrakshak Result PDF 2023

: Details Mentioned

Participant ID

Name

Marks obtained out of 120

NEW DELHI: The Maharashtra Forest Department on Friday released the Maharashtra Forest Guard Result 2023 . Candidates who have appeared for the Maharashtra Vanrakshak Examination 2023 can check and download their results from the official website at mahaforest.gov.in.The exam was conducted in objective multiple choice format from August 2 to August 11, 2023, at various exam centres across the state.Applicants can refer to the below-given step-by-step guide to download and check their Maharashtra Vanrakshak Result 2023 online. A direct link to download the Maha Forest Guard 2023 Result PDF for different locations is also given below for the reference of candidates.Step 1: Visit the official website of the Maharashtra Forest Department: https://mahaforest.gov.in/ Step 2: Click on the "Forest Guard Exam 2023" link.Step 3: Click on the "Result" link.Step 4: Enter your application number and date of birth.Step 5: Click on "Submit".Step 6: Your result will be displayed on the screen. You can download your scorecard for future reference.The Maharashtra Forest Department is conducting this recruitment drive for a total of 2147 vacancies. Those who have passed the written examination will now have to appear for the PET/PST and Skill Test (as applicable). The details for the same will be released on the website in due course.Candidates shall note that the department will also release the merit list later. Therefore, selected candidates are advised to keep checking the official portal of the forest department from time to time."Merit list as well as the next stage of the recruitment process will be published on the website from time to time," reads the official notification."As the case is pending in the Supreme Court, government instructions have been received for the recruitment of forest guards in the remaining areas excluding the scheduled areas. Therefore, the forest report-wise result of the examination conducted for the post of forest guard is hereby announced on the website of the forest department," added the official notification.For other details related to the Maharashtra Forest Guard Recruitment 2023, applicants are advised to refer to the official website of the forest department.
summary:
How to check Maharashtra Forest Guard Result 2023?
Direct Link:Maharashtra Vanrakshak Result PDF 2023: Details MentionedParticipant IDNameMarks obtained out of 120NEW DELHI: The Maharashtra Forest Department on Friday released the Maharashtra Forest Guard Result 2023 .
You can download your scorecard for future reference.The Maharashtra Forest Department is conducting this recruitment drive for a total of 2147 vacancies.
Therefore, selected candidates are advised to keep checking the official portal of the forest department from time to time.
Therefore, the forest report-wise result of the examination conducted for the post of forest guard is hereby announced on the website of the forest department," added the official notification.For other details related to the Maharashtra Forest Guard Recruitment 2023, applicants are advised to refer to the official website of the forest department.

title: MP Forest Guard Result 2023 expected to release soon at esb.mp.gov.in, how to check
text:
How to Check MP Forest Guard Result 2023?

NEW DELHI: The Madhya Pradesh Employees Selection Board (MPESB) will soon announce the MP Forest Guard Result 2023 . Candidates who participated in the exam for MP Forest Guard, Field Guard, Jail Guard, and Assistant Jail Superintendent will be able to download their results by visiting the official website at esb.mp.gov.in, once it is released.The MP Forest Guard exam was held from May 25 to June 20, 2023.Candidates will be able to access their results from the website using their Roll Number and other essential details at the login window.Step 1: Visit the official website at https://esb.mp.gov.in/ Step 2: Once the results are declared, a link to download the result and merit list will be available on the website's homepage. It might be displayed as " MP Forest Guard 2023 Result ," or "Vanrakshak Result 2023."Step 3: Click on the link to download your scorecard and/or merit list. A new page will open, enter your roll number and other details to access your results.Step 4: Download the result and you might need it during the document verification process or for other official purposes.
summary:
How to Check MP Forest Guard Result 2023?
NEW DELHI: The Madhya Pradesh Employees Selection Board (MPESB) will soon announce the MP Forest Guard Result 2023 .
It might be displayed as " MP Forest Guard 2023 Result ," or "Vanrakshak Result 2023.
"Step 3: Click on the link to download your scorecard and/or merit list.
A new page will open, enter your roll number and other details to access your results.Step 4: Download the result and you might need it during the document verification process or for other official purposes.

While the initial glance may suggest similarity, the devil lies in the details, requiring a keen eye for subtle differences. Those brave enough to take on the challenge can find the images below:For those who may have struggled, fret not, as assistance is at hand. Some adept users effortlessly conquered this visual conundrum.Even when everything seems unchanged, keen-eyed users pointed out a subtle difference in the color texture between the two pictures. The human mind can reveal even the most cleverly hidden secrets because of its incredible complexity and limitless ability to perceive. title: Find 'Bat' in the 'Bot' crowd in 6 seconds: the spelling is easy, just hard to spot

title: Test your observation: Can you spot the hidden cat in this image under 9 seconds?

In a world dominated by social media, where minds are constantly bombarded with a barrage of images, videos, and updates, taking a break from the digital frenzy and engaging in activities that stimulate cognitive skills can be a refreshing and rewarding experience. As you identify the hidden objects or patterns, a sense of accomplishment washes over you, rewarding your patience and perseverance. This positive reinforcement encourages you to tackle more challenging puzzles, further strengthening your cognitive abilities. In just 9 seconds, can you find the elusive cat among the vivid blossoms and lush greenery?The clever hiding place the cat chose shows how well it has been able to adapt to its environment over many generations. It is possible for the cat to lie in peace or to watch its surroundings with intense feline curiosity because the stone enclosure offers both shadow and cover.You now have it! Hiding away in the stone enclosure on the left side of the image, the cunning cat has discovered the ideal hiding place. Being an expert at disguising itself, its smooth, camouflaged fur melds perfectly with the worn stones. The delicate outline of the cat's form among the complex textures of the stonework will only be visible to the most perceptive eyes.How long did it take you?

title: Think you're good at observing? Find all the differences in this panda puzzle under 30 seconds
text:
What are the differences?

A variance in one of its ears.

Inconsistency in the size of the panda's mouth.

Absence of a belly button in one photo.

Discrepancy in the number of leaves, with one photo displaying four while the other has three.

Difference observed in the panda's foot.

Take your time: patience is key. carefully examine each detail without rushing, ensuring you don't miss anything.

Focus on patterns: look for patterns or repetitions. sometimes, differences hide within repeated elements.

Start with the big picture: begin by observing the overall scene before diving into specific details. this helps in understanding the context.

Segment the image: break down the image into smaller sections. this makes it easier to spot differences without feeling overwhelmed.

Compare side by side: place the images side by side for a direct comparison. it enhances your ability to identify variations.

Spot the difference puzzles, popular on the internet for their difficulty, create a buzz on social media. Especially for panda lovers, this picture puzzle is heartwarming. The key is sharp observation, focusing on every detail. Missing even small elements can make finding the answer challenging.While the images may initially seem similar, it's crucial to note that there are indeed five distinctions between them.What makes this brain teaser a bit more manageable is its monochromatic color scheme and the simplicity of the background settings. As you tackle such a puzzle, factors like size, colors, and the overall nature of the image must be taken into careful consideration.The use of black and white accents, coupled with a clear setting, serves to streamline the number of elements demanding concentration. However, it's worth mentioning that for some solvers, the monochrome features themselves might pose a challenge in terms of focus. A helpful strategy is to start by dividing the images into multiple sections and focusing on each segment individually. This approach, breaking down the larger image into smaller, more manageable parts, aids in observing minute details, rather than attempting to analyze the entire image as a whole. This method proves effective in enhancing the solver's ability to discern subtle differences within the puzzle.How many differences were you able to spot?Here's a few simple ways to improve yourself in these observation puzzles
summary:
Segment the image: break down the image into smaller sections.
Especially for panda lovers, this picture puzzle is heartwarming.

title: Jharkhand SSC Teacher Recruitment 2024 Schedule Revised; Check details here
text:
JPSTAACCE 2023

:

Read the official notice

As per the recent developments, the Jharkhand Staff Selection Commission in Ranchi has revised the exam date for the Jharkhand Elementary School Trained Assistant Teacher Joint Competitive Examination-2023. This decision is in response to the judgment passed on December 20, 2023, following various petitions filed before the Honorable Jharkhand High Court.In compliance with the court's decision, the Commission is set to open the online application registration portal shortly.The new applications are invited from local residents of Jharkhand who have passed the CTET or TET from neighbouring states. This includes individuals interested in participating in the Jharkhand Primary School Trained Assistant Teacher Joint Competitive Examination-2023.The Commission, in accordance with the court order, deems it necessary to reschedule the examination dates. Initially planned to commence on January 12, 2024, the examination will now begin on February 10, 2024. The detailed examination schedule will be made available after the conclusion of the new online application process, considering the number of candidates and the required examination days.For those meeting the specified criteria, the online application link will be activated soon on the Commission's official website. This step is taken to ensure a fair and just process for all eligible candidates willing to appear in the examination-2023.
summary:
JPSTAACCE 2023:Read the official noticeAs per the recent developments, the Jharkhand Staff Selection Commission in Ranchi has revised the exam date for the Jharkhand Elementary School Trained Assistant Teacher Joint Competitive Examination-2023.
This includes individuals interested in participating in the Jharkhand Primary School Trained Assistant Teacher Joint Competitive Examination-2023.The Commission, in accordance with the court order, deems it necessary to reschedule the examination dates.
Initially planned to commence on January 12, 2024, the examination will now begin on February 10, 2024.
The detailed examination schedule will be made available after the conclusion of the new online application process, considering the number of candidates and the required examination days.For those meeting the specified criteria, the online application link will be activated soon on the Commission's official website.
This step is taken to ensure a fair and just process for all eligible candidates willing to appear in the examination-2023.

For the written test Admit Card download related to the Recruitment of Police Constables in Tripura Police:

The Office of the Chairman of the Selection Committee, Government of Tripura, has announced the release of admit cards for the upcoming written test for the recruitment of Police Constables, both men and women. The written test is scheduled to take place on January 28, 2024 (Sunday). Aspiring candidates can download their admit cards from the official Tripura Police website, www.tripurapolice.gov.in, using the link http://tripurapolice.onlineregistrationindia.com.To download the admit card, candidates must follow the stepwise procedure outlined in the 'SOP for Downloading Admit Card,' available on the Tripura Police website.In case of any technical issues preventing the download, candidates can seek assistance by contacting the PHQ Police Control telephone number 0381-2310177 during working hours from 10:30 AM to 6:00 PM on any working day.Candidates are urged to adhere to the provided instructions and ensure timely acquisition of their admit cards for the written test. The Selection Committee, headed by Jayanta Chakraborty, emphasizes the importance of following the specified guidelines for a smooth and hassle-free process.The written examination for candidates who passed the physical endurance tests for the recruitment of 1000 Police Constables (Both Men & Women) in Tripura Police is scheduled for January 28, 2024 (Sunday), taking place centrally in Agartala from 01:00 pm to 02:00 pm.The written test for the recruitment of 1000 Police Constables (Both Men & Women) in Tripura Police is scheduled for January 28, 2024 (Sunday) from 01:00 pm to 02:00 pm, centrally at Agartala. The test is divided into four parts, each covering different subjects. Part A includes General Intelligence and Reasoning with 15 questions carrying 30 marks. Part B encompasses General Knowledge, covering State, National, and International events, with 15 questions and 30 marks. Part C involves Elementary Mathematics with 10 questions and 20 marks. Lastly, Part D includes English/Hindi/Bengali/Kokborok Comprehension with 5 questions carrying 5 marks. The total test duration allowed is one hour.• The Admit Card is non-transferable.• Candidates must thoroughly read and adhere to all the instructions provided in the Admit Card.• It is mandatory for candidates to report only to their allotted Examination Centre and arrive well in time, following the instructions in the Admit Card.• Candidates without the Admit Card and a photo ID proof (any Government ID card) will not be permitted to enter.• Requests for changing the Exam Centre will not be considered.• Non-compliance with the instructions will lead to disqualification, and the candidate may face Unfair Means Cases, resulting in the non-declaration of their results.For further details and updates, candidates can refer to the official Tripura Police website.

DSSSB Recruitment 2024 Application Fee

The Delhi Subordinate Services Selection Board (DSSSB) has initiated the application process for recruiting over 4000+ vacancies, including NTT Assistant Teacher, PGT, and Clerk. The total comprises 4214 posts, with 2354 in Non-Teaching roles, 297 for PGT Teachers, 1455 for Assistant Teachers (Nursery or NTT), and 108 for Section Officer (Horticulture).Eligible candidates can apply online at dsssbonline.nic.in or dsssb.delhi.gov.in, with the application deadline set for February 7, 2024, across all four recruitments.To be eligible for application, candidates must have completed their 10+2 with a minimum of 45 per cent marks and possess a Diploma/Certificate in Nursery Education Teacher Program. Additionally, candidates should have a B.Ed. qualification. The maximum age limit for candidates is 30 years, with relaxation provided in the upper age limit as per the specified rules. The distribution of reserved posts includes 614 for the general category, 151 for the EWS category, 377 for OBC, 198 for SC, and 115 for ST.The Delhi Subordinate Services Selection Board (DSSSB) has announced a substantial recruitment drive for various posts, including Lower Divisional Clerk (LDC), Junior Assistant, Stenographer Grade-II, Junior Stenographer (Hindi and English), Lower Divisional Clerk cum Typist, Junior Stenographer, Stenographer, and Assistant Grade-I. The total number of vacancies is 2354, and the selection will be conducted through a joint examination. Interested candidates can apply until February 7, 2023. These appointments aim to fill vacant positions across diverse departments of the Delhi Government, with 1074 unreserved, 677 OBC, 289 SC, 100 ST, and 214 EWS category posts.The Delhi Subordinate Services Selection Board (DSSSB) has unveiled an extensive recruitment drive for the position of Post Graduate Teachers (PGT) in government schools across Delhi. The recruitment aims to fill 297 PGT teacher positions in schools under the Delhi Education Directorate and NDMC. The online application process is now open on dsssbonline.nic.in, with the deadline for applications set for February 7, 2023. Interested candidates are encouraged to apply promptly to be considered for these teaching positions.DSSSB has invited applications for 108 posts of Section Officer in MCD and NDMC departments of the national capital. The eligibility criteria for the 89 posts of Section Officer (Horticulture) in MCD include a degree in Science with Agriculture or Botany subject. The pay scale for these positions is set at 35,400 - 1,12,400 in Pay Level-6 Group B, and the age limit for applicants is between 18 to 27 years.In the DSSSB Recruitment 2024, applicants are required to pay an application fee of Rs 100. However, candidates belonging to the SC, ST, and disabled categories are exempted from paying any fee. The application fee must be deposited through the e-pay mode of SBI.
summary:
The maximum age limit for candidates is 30 years, with relaxation provided in the upper age limit as per the specified rules.
The total number of vacancies is 2354, and the selection will be conducted through a joint examination.
The recruitment aims to fill 297 PGT teacher positions in schools under the Delhi Education Directorate and NDMC.
The online application process is now open on dsssbonline.nic.in, with the deadline for applications set for February 7, 2023.
However, candidates belonging to the SC, ST, and disabled categories are exempted from paying any fee.

title: JGGLCCE 2023: JSSC Announces Revised Exam Dates for Jharkhand Graduate Level Exam 2023
text:
Selection Process

Pattern of examination

Appointment

The Jharkhand Staff Selection Commission (JSSC) has announced the examination schedule for the Jharkhand General Graduate Level Combined Competitive Examination (JGGLCCE) 2023 through Advt No 10/2023 and Advt No 11/2023. The revised dates for the examination are January 28 and February 4, 2024, as opposed to the initially planned dates of December 16 and 17, 2023.Candidates should take note of these updated dates for their preparation and participation in the examination.The hall ticket download link will be accessible at jssc.nic.in in the coming days. This recruitment drive endeavours to fill over 2000+ vacancies across diverse departments. Aspirants are advised to monitor the official website for timely updates and the availability of their hall tickets.The JSSC CGL Selection Process includes three stages: Preliminary examination, Main examination, and Document verification. Aspirants must successfully navigate through these stages to secure their position in the selection process.The examination pattern involves an OMR-based test conducted by the Commission. In case of multiple groups, candidate marks will undergo normalization. The merit list will be prepared based on normalized marks, ensuring fairness and accuracy in the assessment process. Normalized marks will be the basis for candidates' merit after the result publication.The examination comprises a single-phase (Main Examination) with objective, multiple-choice questions. Each correct answer carries 3 marks, while incorrect responses result in a 1-mark deduction. Except for language subjects, questions are presented in Hindi and English. The Main Examination consists of three papers held in three shifts, each lasting 2 hours. Paper 1 focuses on Language Knowledge, encompassing Hindi and English language skills with 60 questions each.The Language Knowledge section is qualifying in nature. To pass, candidates must secure a minimum of 30% marks by combining their scores in Hindi and English language knowledge. However, these marks won't contribute to the overall merit list calculation. This section serves as a threshold for candidates to move forward in the selection process.Paper 2 focuses on Marked Tribal and Regional Language, with a total of 100 multiple-choice questions. The examination duration is 2 hours. Candidates can choose to appear for the exam in any one language among Hindi, English, Urdu, Santhali, Bengali, Mundari (Munda), Ho, Khadiya, Kudukh (Uraon), Kurmali, Khortha, Nagpuri, Panchpargania. Additionally, candidates have the option to appear in either Odia or Sanskrit based on their preference.Candidates must secure a minimum of 30 per cent marks in the identified tribal and regional language (chosen from the specified list) in Paper 2. This requirement is mandatory for qualification in this section of the examination.Paper 3 covers General Knowledge with a total of 150 questions and a duration of 2 hours. The distribution of topics is as follows:(a) General Studies - 30 questions(b) General Science - 20 questions(c) General Mathematics - 20 questions(d) Mental Ability Test - 20 questions(e) Computer Knowledge - 20 questions(f) Knowledge related to Jharkhand State - 40 questionsTo qualify in the General Knowledge test (Paper-3), candidates must secure a minimum of 30 per cent marks. This requirement is mandatory for candidates to successfully clear the General Knowledge section of the examination.Note: The minimum qualifying marks for Paper-1 (Language Knowledge) are set at 30%. Candidates scoring below this threshold will be deemed unsuccessful and ineligible for selection. Furthermore, the evaluation of Paper 2 and Paper 3 for such candidates will not be carried out. Similarly, candidates scoring less than 30% in the marked regional/tribal language section (Paper-2) will also not have their Paper-3 evaluated.Success in the examination does not automatically guarantee appointment to service posts. The Government of Jharkhand will conduct inquiries to determine the candidate's suitability, considering their character and overall fitness for public service.Appointments in the service are periodically made by the Department of Personnel, Administrative Reforms, and Official Language, Government of Jharkhand. Selections for candidates from Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, Extremely Backward Class (Schedule-1), Backward Class (Schedule-2), and economically weaker sections will adhere to special representation orders in the service for the respective categories.
summary:
Selection ProcessPattern of examinationAppointmentThe Jharkhand Staff Selection Commission (JSSC) has announced the examination schedule for the Jharkhand General Graduate Level Combined Competitive Examination (JGGLCCE) 2023 through Advt No 10/2023 and Advt No 11/2023.
Paper 1 focuses on Language Knowledge, encompassing Hindi and English language skills with 60 questions each.The Language Knowledge section is qualifying in nature.
To pass, candidates must secure a minimum of 30% marks by combining their scores in Hindi and English language knowledge.
This requirement is mandatory for qualification in this section of the examination.Paper 3 covers General Knowledge with a total of 150 questions and a duration of 2 hours.
This requirement is mandatory for candidates to successfully clear the General Knowledge section of the examination.Note: The minimum qualifying marks for Paper-1 (Language Knowledge) are set at 30%.

How to download WB Police Final Written Admit Card 2023?

Direct Link:

Marking Scheme

: The West Bengal Police Recruitment Board (WBPRB) has released the admit card for the West Bengal Lady Constable Final Written Examination 2023 today, January 10, 2024. Candidates who have qualified for the written test can check and download the hall ticket from the official website at wbpolice.gov.in The WB Lady Police 2023 written exam will be conducted on January 21, 2024.Now, the recruitment board has issued the admit card for the eligible candidates. All the candidates who qualifed for the Physical Measurement Test (PMT) and Physical Efficiency Test (PET) will be called to appear in the Final Written Examination conducted by the West Bengal Police Recruitment Board.The Final Written Examination will have 85 Multiple-choice objective questions (MCQs), each carrying 01 (one) mark. The duration of the examination will be 1 (One) hour. The question paper will be set in two languages (Bengali & Nepali) except for questions in the English language. Questions of the Final Written Examination shall be from the following subjects:-Step 1. Visit the official website at wbpolice.gov.inStep 2. On the homepage, go to the 'Recruitment' tabStep 3. Now, click on the link that reads, "Download e-Admit cards for Final Written Examination"Step 4. You will be redirected to a new page, enter your login details and click on submitStep 5. Your admit card will be displayed on the screenStep 6. Download and take a printout of the same for future referenceIncorrect answers in the Final Written Examination will result in negative marking. For each wrong answer, 25% of the marks assigned to that question will be deducted. The West Bengal Police Recruitment Board will determine the specific scheme and syllabus for the Final Written Examination. The qualifying marks required to proceed to the next stage will be determined by the West Bengal Police Recruitment Board.

Q. When will the Group Exercise and Personal Interview be conducted for SBI PO candidates?

Q. What is the selection process for SBI PO Phase III?

: The State Bank of India has released the tentative dates for the SBI PO Interview, Group Exercise and Psychometric Test. Candidates who took the main examination can check the dates of the interview round on the official website at sbi.co.in.As per the schedule, the PO Psychometric Test will be held from January 16 onwards. Whereas, the Group Exercise and Personal Interview (At LHO centres) will be conducted from January 21, 2024 onwards.The main test took place on December 5, 2023, at different exam centers throughout the state.Only those candidates who successfully cleared the initial exam were allowed to participate in the main test.The third phase of the selection process comprises (i) Psychometric Test (ii) Group Exercise (iii) Interview.The SBI will use a psychometric test to understand the personalities of candidates selected for Phase III. The test results will be presented to the interview panel for a comprehensive assessment.Candidates must pass both Phase II and Phase III individually. Marks from the Main Examination (Phase-II), including both the Objective Test and Descriptive Test, will be combined with Phase III marks to create the final merit list. However, marks from the Preliminary Examination (Phase-I) will not be considered in the final merit list for selection.Note: The marks obtained by the candidates in Phase-II (Main Examination both Objective & Descriptive Tests) and Phase-III (Group Exercise & Interview) will be normalised to 100 marks as detailed below.The PO Psychometric Test is scheduled to be held from January 16 onwards, according to the released schedule by the State Bank of India.The Group Exercise and Personal Interview (At LHO centres) for SBI PO candidates will be conducted from January 21, 2024, onwards, as per the provided schedule.The third phase of the SBI PO selection process comprises (i) Psychometric Test (ii) Group Exercise (iii) Interview, as detailed in the released information.

title: SSC Delhi Police Constable Final Answer Key 2023 released on ssc.nic.in, direct link to download
text:
How to download SSC Delhi Police Constable Final Answer Key 2023?

Direct Link:

NEW DELHI: The Staff Selection Commission on Monday released the SSC Delhi Police Constable Final Answer Key 2023 . Candidates who have appeared for the Constable (Executive) Male and Female in Delhi Police Examination, 2023 can download the final answer key from the official website at ssc.nic.in.SSC Delhi Police Constable was declared on December 31, 2023.Candidates can now download the final answer key and match their answers/responses against the same. The Computer Based Examination (CBT) for Constable Male and Female in Delhi Police was conducted from November 14 to December 03, 2023, at different examination centres across the country.Candidates can refer to the below-mentioned step-by-step process to download the SSC Delhi Police Final Answer Key 2023 from the website or they can click on the direct link given below for the reference.Step 1: Go to the official website at ssc.nic.in Step 2: On the homepage, click on the link available as "Constable (Executive) Male and Female in Delhi Police Examination, 2023: Uploading of Candidates’ Response Sheet(s) along with Final Answer Keys and Marks."Step 3: A PDF will open on the screen, go through the details and scroll down to the bottom of the page to click on the link to access the final answer key.Step 4: A new window will open, enter your login details and submit.Step 5: The SSC Delhi Police Constable 2023 Final Answer Key will be displayed on the screen.Step 6: Download the same and take its printout for further reference.The marks of the shortlisted/ not shortlisted candidates have also been made available on website of the Commission on January 8. This facility too will be available till January 22, 2024. Candidates may check their marks by logging in using their Username (Registration Number) and Password on the website of the Commission and clicking on the Result/ Marks tab on the candidate dashboard.This recruitment drive is being conducted to fill up a total of 7547 vacancies for the post of Constable (Male & Female). Candidates shortlisted in the Computer Based Test (CBT) will appear in the Physical Measurement Test (PMT) and Physical Standard Test (PST).For further information and additional details, candidates are advised to check out the official website of the SSC.
summary:
How to download SSC Delhi Police Constable Final Answer Key 2023?
Direct Link:NEW DELHI: The Staff Selection Commission on Monday released the SSC Delhi Police Constable Final Answer Key 2023 .
Candidates who have appeared for the Constable (Executive) Male and Female in Delhi Police Examination, 2023 can download the final answer key from the official website at ssc.nic.in.SSC Delhi Police Constable was declared on December 31, 2023.Candidates can now download the final answer key and match their answers/responses against the same.
This facility too will be available till January 22, 2024.
Candidates shortlisted in the Computer Based Test (CBT) will appear in the Physical Measurement Test (PMT) and Physical Standard Test (PST).For further information and additional details, candidates are advised to check out the official website of the SSC.
